lyrics:
Aajanubahum Aravindha Nethram
Athmabhi Ramam Manasa Smarami (2)
Bhoolokha Vaikunta Parthi Nivasam
Prabhu Sai Ramam Manasa Smarami (2)
title: Aajanubahum Aravindha Nethram
translation: I invoke in my mind, the long-armed, lotus-eyed, indweller, Rama, who resides in Vaikunta (abode of the Gods). He is also Lord Sai, residing in Puttaparthi.

lyrics:
Aao Aao Sai Pyare
Kirtan Karu Main Sai Thumhare
Aao Aao Sai Pyare
Thum Ho Mere Nayano Ke Tare
Darshan Do Jivan Ke Sahare (2)
title: Aao Aao Sai Pyare
translation: Please come, beloved Sai, let me sing your glory. O Supreme Lord, You are the support of my life and the shining star of my eyes.

lyrics:
Aao Gopala Giridhari
Aao Aao Antharyami
Aao Aao Anandha Sai
Aao Gopala Giridhari
Aao Aao Atmanivasi
Aao Aao Shanthi Nivasi
title: Aao Gopala Giridhari
translation: Come, O Gopala! You held up the mountain Govardhana to save Your devotees. We welcome You the indweller of our hearts. Lord Sai, You reside in the abode of peace and grant bliss.

lyrics:
Aao Pyare Nayan Hamare Sai Hamare Aao
Thum Bin Koi Nahi Rakhvale
Thum Bin Kaun Sahare (Baba) (2)
Aao Sai Pyare
Sai Hamare Aao (3)
title: Aao Pyare Nayan Hamare Sai Hamare Aao
translation: Please come our beloved Lord Sai! You are as precious as our eyes. Without You, there is no one to protect us. Who but You can support us, O Beloved Sai?

lyrics:
Aao Sai Narayana Darshan Deejo
Thum Ho Jagat Vidhatha (2)
Thumhi Ho Brahma Thumhi Ho Vishnu
Thumhi Ho Shankara Roopa (2)
Thumhi Ho Rama Thumhi Ho Krishna
Thumhi Ho Vishwa Vidhatha (2)
title: Aao Sai Narayana Darshan Deejo
translation: Welcome Sai Narayana, Creator of the Universe. Grant us your Darshan. You are none other than Lord Rama, Krishna, Vishnu, Brahma and Shankara.

lyrics:
Akhanda Jyothi Jalao Sai Man Mandir Me
Akhanda Jyothi Jalao (2)
Koti Surya Sama Theja Swaroopa
Sai Thum Ho Divya Swaroopa
Akhanda Jyothi Jalao (2)
Divya Jyothi Gnana Jyothi Prema Jyothi Jalao
title: Akhanda Jyothi Jalao
translation: Sai, light the eternal flame within the temple of my heart and illumine my intelligence. Embodiment of love and divinity, with the effulgence equal to that of million suns, light in me the flame of divinity, knowledge and love.

lyrics:
Akhila Jagath Ke Dhatha Sai
Shirdi Nivasi Bhagwan
Darshan Do Bhagwan (Sai)
Kalimala Bhanjana Parama Dayaghana
Karuna Nidhe Shirdi Vasa
Karuna Nidhe Parthi Vasa
Dina Janavana Parthi Mahesha
Shirdi Nivasi Bhagwan
Darshan Do Bhagwan (Sai)
title: Akhila Jagath Ke Dhatha Sai
translation: O Lord Sai of Shirdi and Parthi, creator of the cosmos, supremely merciful, You are the destroyer of the evils of the Kali age and the friend of the downtrodden. Kindly grant the vision of Your form

lyrics:
Akhilandeshwari Raja Rajeshwari
Dhaya Sagari Parama Krupakari
Samba Vinodhini Shiva Sai Shankari
Mangala Gauri Matha Maheshwari
Samba Vinodhini Shiva Sai Shankari
title: Akhilandeshwari Raja Rajeshwari
translation: Supremely Divine, the Goddess of the whole Universe, the ocean of compassion, is Sai Shankari. She is the delight of Shiva, and the divine mother who grants auspiciousness.

lyrics: Alakh Niranjana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana Narayan Narayan\nNarayan Narayan Narayan Sai Narayan\nNarayan Narayan Narayan Sathya Narayan
title: Alakh Niranjana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
translation: Lord Narayana (Lord Sai) is the imperceptible, faultless destroyer of the cycle of birth and death.

lyrics:
Allah Bhajo Maula Bhajo He Allah Sai Bhagavan
Ram Bhajo He Krishna Bhajo He Rama Krishna Bhagavan
Nanak Bhajo Gautama Bhajo He Buddha Sai Bhagavan
Yeshu Bhajo Zoarastra Bhajo He Mahavir Bhagavan
Sai Bhajo Shirdi Sai Bhajo He Shirdi Sai Bhagavan
Satya Bhajo Satya Sai Bhajo He Satya Sai Bhagavan
title: Allah Bhajo Maula Bhajo
translation: Repeat the different names of God: Allah, Rama, Krishna, Nanak, Gautam Buddha, Jesus, Zoroaster, Mahavir, Shirdi Sai and Satya Sai.

lyrics:
Allah Nama Bhajo Bhajore Bhajo Maula Nama Bhajo Bhajore Bhajo
Nanak Yeshu Mahavir Nama Bhajo
Shri Buddha Deva Bhajo Bhajore Bhajo Shirdi Sai ...
... Baba Bhajo Bhajore Bhajo
Shri Raghu Rama Bhajo Govinda Kr'shna Bhajo
Shri Sathya Sai Bhajo Bhajore Bhajo
title: Allah Nama Bhajo Bhajore Bhajo
translation: Recite the names of Allah, Nanak, Jesus, Mahavir, and Buddha. Worship Lord Shirdi Sai, Rama (ofRaghu dynasty), Govinda, Krishna, and Sathya Sai.e.

lyrics:
Allah Thum Ho Ishwar Thum Ho
Thumhi Ho Ram Rahim Thumhi Ho Ram Rahim
Yeshu Thum Ho Nanak Thum Ho
Zorastra Bhi Ho Mahavir Thum Ho
Gauthama Buddha Karim Gauthama Buddha Karim
Mere Ram Mere Ram Ram Rahim (3)
title: Allah Thum Ho Ishwar Thum Ho
translation: O Lord! You are known by many names: Allah, Ishwara, Ram, Rahim, Jesus, Guru Nanak, Zoroaster, Mahavir, Karim and Krishna

lyrics:
Allah Yesu Buddha Deva Antaru Neevae
Moula Sai Mahavira Nanaku Neevae
Rama Krishna Shiva Rupa Dhaariyu Neevae
Vedha Gita Grantha Mula Saramu Neevae
Madhamulanni Poojinchu Daivamu Neevae
Sarva Dharma Priya Satya Sai Neevae
Sairam Sairam Sairam Satya Sairam (2)
title: Allah Yesu Buddha Deva Antaru Neevae
translation: O Sairam! You are Allah, Jesus, Buddha, Mahavira and Guru Nanak. You took the forms of Rama, Krishna and Shiva. You are the essence of the Vedas, the Gita and the Granth Saheb (Sacred Book of the Sikhs). You are the One Lord worshipped by all the religions. You are Sathya Sai who loves all religions. We chant your name.

lyrics:
Amba Bhavani Shiva Shambhu Kumara
Shri Gana Natha Shantakara
Purana Purusha Satya Sai Natha
Pranava Swaroopa Parthisha
title: Amba Bhavani Shiva Shambhu Kumara
translation: The Lord of the divine forces is the beloved son of Shiva and Mother Parvathi, and the giver of peace. Lord Sathya Sai of Parthi, is the eternal being andembodiment of Aum.

lyrics:
Amba Mandahasa Vadhani Manohari Sai Jagath Janani
Matha Matha Matha Jagath Janani (Amba Mandahasa...)
Jagath Janani Shubha Karini
Sai Jaganmatha Sathya Sai Jaganmatha (Amba)
title: Amba Mandahasa Vadhani Manohari
translation: Sai is the charming, gently-smiling Mother who has created this Universe. She bestows auspiciousness.

lyrics:
Amba Parameshwari Akhilandeshwari
Adi Parashakti Palaya Mam
Shri Bhuvaneshwari Raja Rajeshwari
Ananda Rupini Palaya Mam
title: Amba Parameshwari
translation: Supreme Goddess of the entire creation, the divine energy is the Goddess of the three worlds. The sovereign ruler, whose very nature is bliss, is our protector.

lyrics:
Amba Sahita Samba Sadashiva
Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva
Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva
Parvati Ramana Sadashiva
Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva
title: Amba Sahita Samba Sadashiva
translation: Praise Lord Shiva, who is accompanied by Amba (Parvati). Praise the Lord of Lords, the destroyer of evil.

lyrics:
Ambe Janani Abhirami
Abhaya Pradayini Shivakami
Ambe Janani Abhirami
Shambavi Shankari Sarveshwari
Shanta Swarupini Shiva Shankari
Sathya Swarupini Sai Matha
Sashwatha Ananda Dhayini Matha
title: Ambe Janani Abhirami
translation: Mother Parvathi, creator and protector, is the graceful mother of all. Mother Sai is the embodiment of Truth and Peace and the grantor of Eternal Bliss

lyrics:
Ambika Thanaya Gajanana
Gaja Vadana Gana Natha Gajanana
Pahi Ganesha Vinayaka (2)
Thribhuvana Palaka Mangala Dhayaka
Vidhya Buddhi Siddhi Pradhayaka
Pahi Ganesha Vinayaka (3)
title: Ambika Thanaya Gajanana
translation: Elephant-faced Lord Ganesha, son of Amba, is the Lord of all divine forces. Surrender to the Lord of all three worlds, the bestower of auspiciousness who grants knowledge, wisdom and intellect.

lyrics:
Ananda Maya Bhagwan Hey Prema Maya Bhagwan
O Bhaghwan Sai Bhagwan
Ananda Maya Bhagwan Hey Prema Maya Bhagwan
He Karuna Nidhe Prabhu Sai Ram
Kripa Nidhe Dino Ke Pran
Aao Prabhu Mujhe Charana Lagalo
Daya Karo Bhagwan
Mujhe Kripa Karo Bhagwan
title: Ananda Maya Bhagwan
translation: Lord Sai, who is full of bliss and love, is the ocean of compassion and grace, the very life of the downtrodden. Take me, O Lord, keep me at Your feet, and shower Your grace and mercy on me.

lyrics:
Ananda Ram Ananda Shyam
Narayana Hari Narayana
Narayana Sai Narayana (2)
Prema Svarupa Brahmananda
Satchidananda Hari Narayana
Narayana Hari Narayana (2)
Narayana Sai Narayana (2)
title: Ananda Ram Ananda Shyam
translation: The names of Rama, Krishna and Sai (Narayana) embody love, truth, knowledge, divine bliss, and invoke joy.

lyrics:
Ananda Sagara Murlidhara
Meera Prabhu Radhe Shyam Venugopala
Nanda Yashodha Ananda Kishora
Jai Jai Gokula Bala Jai Sai Gopala
title: Ananda Sagara Muralidhara
translation: Glory to Lord Krishna, Lord of Meera and Radha, who plays melodies on the flute. He is the cowherd son of Nanda and Yashoda, from Gokula

lyrics:
Anandam Anandam Sai Namam
Anandam Anandam Sai Geetham
Anandam Anandam Sai Dhyanam
Anandam Anandam Sai Rupam
Anandam Anandam Sai Namam (2)
Sai Ramam Sai Geetham
Sai Dhyanam Sai Rupam
Sai Namam Sai Namam (3)
title: Anandam Anandam Sai Namam
translation: Chanting the Name of Sai, listening to His music, meditating on His name looking at His form gives us bliss and happiness.

lyrics:
Anandame Sai Namame
Adbhuthame Sai Geethame
Akhandame Jyothirmayame
Sundarame Sai Roopame (Athi)
title: Anandame Sai Namame
translation: Blissful is Sai's name and transcendental are Sai Bhajans. Eternal is His effulgence and exceedingly beautiful is His form.

lyrics:
Anatha Bandho Sai Prabho
Aparadha Kshama Karo Sai Prabho
Jiva Yatra Me Sath Raho
Prem Bhakti Hamko Dijo
Hrudaya Mandhir Se Math Jao
Charanamrutha Seva Dijo Prabho
title: Anatha Bandho Sai Prabho
translation: Lord Sai, kinsman of the destitute, please forgive our erring ways. Accompany us in our life's journey and allow love and devotion to be born within us. Do not desert the temple of our hearts. Let us serve at Your immortal feet.

lyrics:
Anjaneya Vira Hanumantha Shura
Vayu Kumara Vanara Vira
Anjaneya Vira Hanumantha Shura
Vayu Kumara Vanara Vira
Shri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Jaya Ram Ram (3)
Shri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Sai Ram Ram
title: Anjaneya Vira Hanumantha Shura
translation: The mighty, and powerful Anjaneya is the offspring of the Wind God. Glory be unto Lord Rama and Lord Sai.

lyrics:
Antar Jyothi Jalao Sai
Brahma Sanatani Daya Karo
Daya Karo He Poorna Jyothirmayi
Shiva Shakthi Mayi Krupa Karo
Deena Dayamayi Pathitha Pavani
Sai Jagat Janani Daya Karo
Sai Jagat Janani Krupa Karo
title: Antar Jyothi Jalao Sai
translation: O Sai, light the inner flame of my heart. O effulgent Lord, embodiment of Brahma, please have mercy on us. Shower Your grace, O embodiment of divine energy, and mother of the Universe. You are the salvation of the poor and helpless.

lyrics:
Antaranga Sai Anatha Natha Sai
Dina Bandhu Sai Karuna Sindhu Sai
Antaranga Sai Anatha Natha Sai
Rama Krishna Shiva Shakthi Prema Rupa Sai
Yuga Avathara Baba Shri Sathya Sai
title: Antaranga Sai Anatha Natha Sai
translation: Sai, the indweller, Lord of the destitute, is the friend and kinsman of the downtrodden. He is all merciful Rama, Krishna, Shiva, Shakthi (Mother Goddess), and personification of love. He is the incarnation of the (Kali) age.

lyrics:
Anupama Sundara Nanda Kishora
Brindavana Ghana Shyam
Murali Madhava Radhe Govinda
Madhusudhana Ghana Shyam Sathya Sai Sundara Shyam
Kunja Vihari Mandara Giridhari
Kamala Nayana Bhagwan
Bhakto Ke Prabhu Parthishwara Sai
Natavara Sundara Shyam Sathya Sai Sundara Shyam
title: Anupama Sundara Nanda Kishora
translation: The ever beautiful son of Nanda, is the flute-playing Krishna. He walked the gardens of Brindavan and lifted the Mandara mountain to protect His devotees. The lotus-eyed Lord Krishna, the charming dancer is Lord Sai of Parthi.

lyrics:
Ao Ao Sai Natha
Ao Ao He Jagannatha
Ao Ao Sai Natha
Darshan Ke Liye Taras Rahe Hai
Nayan Hamare O Sai
Darsha Dikhao Daya Ke Sagar
Ao Shankar He Parameshvar
[Ao Ao Sai Natha (3)]
title: Ao Ao Sai Natha
translation: Please come, Sai, Lord of the Universe, our eyes are eager to see Your divine form. O Lord Shankara, the ocean of compassion, grant us Your vision.

lyrics:
Araja Suno Mere Parama Kripalu
Partishvara Sai Deva
Araja Suno Mere Parama Kripalu
Satya Sanatana Antaryami
Sakala Charachara Tum Ho Swami
Janama Marana Se Par Karo
Bhava Bandhan Se Uddhar Karo (Baba...)
title: Araja Suno Mere Parama Kripalu
translation: Hear my request, all-merciful Parthi Sai. You are the eternal Truth, the indweller and the Lord of all creation. Please liberate me from this bondage of existence and take me beyond the process of life and death..

lyrics:
Aravinda Lochana Arta Janavana
Sai Narayana Satyanarayana
Aravinda Lochana Arta Janavana
Ishvaramba Nandana Dosha Nivarana
Parama Niranjana He Shubhanana
title: Aravinda Lochana Arta Janavana
translation: The lotus-eyed Lord Sai (Narayana) protects the helpless. He is the son of Easvaramma and He removes sins. He is the immaculate Lord, who bestows auspiciousness.

lyrics:
At Your Feet Dear Lord We pray
Bless Us With Your Love This Day
Sai Baba, Sai Baba, You Are Krishna, You Are Rama
Oh Baba, Oh Baba, You Are Mother, You Are Father
All Names, Every Form, All That Was And Will Be Born
(You are) All Names, Every Form, All That Is Forever More
title: At Your Feet Dear Lord We Pray
translation: None

lyrics:
Atma Rama Ananda Ramana
Achyutha Keshava Hari Narayana
Bhava Bhaya Harana Vandhitha Charana
Raghukula Bhushana Rajiva Lochana
Adhi Narayana Anantha Sayana
Satchidananda Shri Sathya Narayana
title: Atma Rama Ananda Ramana
translation: Rama, the indweller of our hearts, is the embodiment of bliss. Narayana (Hari), who is eternal, removes the fear of existence. I bow at the feet of lotus-eyed Rama, the jewel of the Raghu dynasty. Lord Narayana, rests on Adhi Shesha. He is Sathya Narayana, the embodiment of truth, bliss and knowledge.

lyrics:
Atmalingam Bhajore Ati Adbhutha Lingam Bhajore
Naga Lingam Navamani Lingam
Nabhi Kamala Udhbhava Lingam
Ishvara Lingam Bhajore Partishvara Lingam Bhajore
Ishvara Lingam Bhajore Saishvara Lingam Bhajore
title: Atmalingam Bhajore
translation: Sing in praise of the wonderful lingam that has emerged from within the navel of Sai. It is adorned with nine precious gems and the hood of a cobra. Sing in praise of the lingam that verily represents Lord Sai.

lyrics:
Ayodhya Ke Sita Ram Brindavan Ke Radhe Shyam
Radhe Shyam Jaya Radhe Shyam
Radha Madhava Radhe Shyam
Sai Ram Jai Sai ram
Partipurishvara Sai ram
Shirdipurishvara Sai Ram
title: Ayodhya Ke Sita Ram
translation: Rama, Lord of Sita, resides in Ayodhya. Krishna, Lord of Radha, in Brindavan. Worship Lord Sai of Puttaparthi and of Shirdi.

lyrics:
Ayodhyavasi Ram Hai Dvaraka Me Aye
Dvarakavasi Shyam Hai Shirdi Me Aye
Shirdi Sai Ram Hai Parthi Satya Sai
Bolo Ram Sai Ram Bolo Satya Sai Ram
title: Ayodhyavasi Ram Hai Dvaraka Me Aye
translation: Lord of Ayodhya, Rama, incarnated in Dvaraka as Krishna, as Sai in Shirdi and in Puttaparthi. Chant the name of Sai Ram.

lyrics:
Ayodhyavasi Ram Ram Ram Dasharatha Nandhana Ram
Pathitha Pavana Janaki Jeevana Sita Mohana Ram
Ayodhyavasi Ram Ram Ram Dasharatha Nandhana Ram
Pathitha Pavana Janaki Jeevana Sita Mohana Ram
title: Ayodhyavasi Ram Ram Ram Dasharatha Nandhana Ram
translation: Lord Rama, the resident of Ayodhya and the beloved son of King Dasharatha, is the savior of the fallen and the Lord of Janaki (Sita).

lyrics:
Ayyappa Sharaname Ayyappa Sharaname Ayyappa Sharaname
... Swami Ayyappa Sharaname (2)
Sabari Nayaka Shanthi Dhayaka Ayyappa Sharaname
... Swami Ayyappa Sharaname
Parthi Nayaka Prashanti Dhayaka Ayyappa Sharaname
... Swami Ayyappa Sharaname
title: Ayyappa Sharaname Ayyappa Sharaname
translation: Take refuge in Ayyappa, the Lord of Sabari mountain and of Puttaparthi, who bestows supreme peace.

lyrics:
Baba Ao Mere Kirtan Me
Antaryami Darsha Dikhao
Naiya Hamari Par Lagao
Baba Ao Mere Kirtan Me
Antar Jyoti Jalao Swami
Jivan Jyoti Tum Ho Sai
title: Baba Ao Mere Kirtan Me
translation: Baba, O indwelling Lord, please come and grant Your darshan when I sing your glory. Guide our lives across this ocean of existence and awaken our inner divinity. You are the light of our lives.

lyrics:
Baba Dil Me Base Raho
Janam Janam Me Sath Raho
Hath Na Chodo Anath Natha
Sath Na Chodo Sai Prabho
Charano Me lelo Sai Prabho (Tere)
title: Baba Dil Me Base Raho
translation: Baba, please reside in my heart and be with me all my life. Please do not let go of my hand O Lord of the destitutes. I surrender to thee, protect me O Lord Sai.

lyrics:
Bada Chitta Chor Manmohan
Mira Chittachor Jaganmohan
Ayodhya Ke Sita Ram Brindavan Ke Radhe Shyam
Shirdi Ke Sai Baba Parthi Ke Satya Sai
title: Bada Chitta Chor Manmohan
translation: You are the great ""stealer of hearts"", the enchanter of the mind, the one who stole Meera's heart. You are Rama in Ayodhya, Krishna in Brindavan, Sai Baba of Shirdi and Sathya Sai of Parthi.

lyrics:
Bada Chitta Chora Brindavana Sanchara
Gopala Gopala Hey Murali Gopala
Bada Chitta Chora Brindavana Sanchara
Govardhanoddhara Gopala Bala
Gopi Manohara Radhe Gopala
title: Bada Chitta Chora Brindavana Sanchara
translation: Gopala, You are the great ""stealer of hearts"", who walked the gardens of Brindavan. As the young cowherd boy with the enchanting flute, You lifted the Govardhana mountain (to protect the devotees), and captivated Radha and the Gopis.

lyrics:
Bala Gopala Sai Bala Gopala
Devaki Nandana Gopala
Bala Gopala Sai Bala Gopala
Vasudeva Nandhana Gopala
Yashodha Bala Gopala
Nandha Gopala Anandha Gopala
Sai Gopala Sathya Sai Gopala
title: Bala Gopala Sai Bala Gopala
translation: Chant the name of Lord Sai. He is none other than the child Gopala, son of Devaki and Vasudeva, and the ever blissful (foster) son of Yashoda and Nanda

lyrics:
Bansidhara Kanhaiya Ghana Shyama Sundara
Giridhari Gopa Bala Brindavana Vihara
Bansidhara Kanhaiya Ghana Shyama Sundara
Govinda Madhava Hare Madhusudhana Mukunda
Radhe Gopala Radhe Gopala Radhe Gopala Radhe
title: Bansidhara Khanaiya Ghanashayama Sundara
translation: Chant the name of the holder of the flute, the charming child who is as beautiful as the dark cloud. The holder of the mountain and the beloved child of the cowherds, Krishna, played in Brindavan. Govinda is Vishnu and the slayer of the demon Madhu.

lyrics:
Beda Par Karo Mere Sai
Uddhar Karo Mere Baba
Beda Par Karo Mere Sai
Allah Ishwara Sai Baba
Shirdi Baba Parthi Baba
Raham Nazar Karo Sai Baba
Daya Karo Sai Krupa Karo
title: Beda Par Karo Mere Sai
translation: Lord Sai, please uplift me and help me cross the ocean of life and death. Shower Your mercy, grace and compassion on us, Sai (known also as Allah, Iswar, Shirdi Baba)

lyrics:
Bhagavan Sri Satya Sai
Come and make my heart Your home
Come and make my life Your life
Come and make me Yours
title: Bhagavan Sri Satya Sai
translation: Self-explanatory

lyrics:
Bhagavan, Shri Satya Sai Baba Bhagavan, Kali Yuga Avatara Bhagavan...
...Divine Love Of My Heart, Come To Me
Hey Ghana Shyam Hey Sai Ram Chant The Names Of The Lord
Sai Hold Me In Love, Lift Me Above, Bring Me Home To Thee
Bhagavan, Sai Ram, Come To Me My Lord
Hey Sita Ram, Hey Radha Shyam, Chant The Names Of The Lord
Swami Fill Me With Peace, Grant Me Release, Make Me One With Thee
Bhagavan, Sai Ram, Be With Me My Lord
title: Bhagavan, Shri Satya Sai Baba
translation: Self-explanatory

lyrics:
Bhaja Govindam Bhaja Gopalam
Paramanandam Shyama Bhajo
Nityananda Brahmananda
Satchidananda Shyama Bhajo
Prema Svarupam Dina Dayalam
Paramanandam Sai Bhajo
title: Bhaja Govindam Bhaja Gopalam
translation: Chant the names of Govinda, Gopala and Krishna and attain eternal bliss. Krishna and Sai are love incarnates and personify truth, knowledge and bliss. They are protectors of the fallen and afflicted. Singing their names gives endless and supreme happiness.

lyrics:
Bhajamana Govinda Gopala
Govinda Gopala Gopala
Bhajamana Govinda Gopala
Govinda Bolo Hari Gopala Bolo (2)
Govinda Gopala Gopala
title: Bhajamana Govinda Gopala
translation: O Mind! Worship Govinda and Gopala (Lord Krishna).

lyrics:
Bhajamana Ramam Shri Ramam
Sundara Shyamala Komala Ramam
Bhajamana Ramam Shri Ramam
Bharatha Lakshmana Pujita Ramam
Maruti Sevita Manobhiramam
Pankaja Lochana Pattabhi Ramam
title: Bhajamana Ramam Shri Ramam
translation: O Mind, chant the names of Lord Rama, the dark-hued, handsome and gentle Lord. He is the protector of His devotees, the One worshipped by Bharatha, Lakshmana and Hanuman. The lotus-eyed Lord Rama is the crowned King (of Ayodhya).

lyrics:
Bhajana Karo Manva Govinda Hare
Govinda Murare Gopala Murare
Bhajana Karo Manva Govinda Hare
Mathura Natha He Giridhari
Radha Madhava He Giridhari (2)
title: Bhajana Karo Manva Govinda Hare
translation: Chant, O mind, the name of Lord Krishna, protector of devotees, destroyer of Mura. He is the Lord residing in Mathura who held up the mountain (to save the devotees). He is Krishna, the beloved Lord of Radha.

lyrics:
Bhajo Bhajo Ram Sathya Sai Ram
Bhajo Bhajo Ram Sai Ghana Shyam
Kaliyug Ke Avatar
Jagadoddara Sai Bhagwan
Patita Pavana Sai Ram
title: Bhajo Bhajo Ram Sathya Sai Ram
translation: Chant the names of Rama, the redeemer of the fallen, the dark-hued Krishna, and of Sathya Sai, the incarnation of the Kali age, the savior of the World.

lyrics:
Bhajo Bhajo Vitthala Panduranga Vitthala
Pandhari Natha Panduranga Bhajo Mana Vitthala
Bhajo Bhajo Vitthala Panduranga Vitthala
Partishvara Sai Natha Vitthala
Parameshvara Satya Sai Vitthala
Rakhumai Vitthala Ranga Sai Vitthala
title: Bhajo Bhajo Vittala Panduranga Vittala
translation: Worship Lord Krishna by chanting His many names: Panduranga, Vitthala, Lord of the city of Pandhari, and The Lord of all, Sathya Sai of Puttaparthi.

lyrics:
Bhajo Gana Nayaka Gajavadana
Mangala Dayaka Shubha Charana
Siddhi Vinayaka Shiva Nandana
Ananda Dayaka Chitta Chandana
Buddhi Pradayaka Jagavandana
Mangala Dayaka Shubha Charana
title: Bhajo Ghana Nayaka Gajavadhana
translation: Worship the elephant-faced Lord Ganesha, the leader of divine forces, and son of Lord Shiva. He bestows success, bliss, auspiciousness, and liberation. He is revered by one and all.

lyrics:
Bhajo Ghana Shyam Bhajo Murali Gopala Bhajo
Nanda Ke Lal Bhajo Radhe
Bhajo Ghana Shyam Bhajo Murali Gopala Bhajo
Giridhara Gopala Mathura Natha
Kamala Nayana He Kaivalya Dhatha
Nanda Ke Lal Bhajo Radhe
title: Bhajo Ghana Shyam Bhajo
translation: Worship Krishna, the dark-hued Lord who plays the flute. The delight of Nanda and Radha, He is the Lord of Mathura who held the mountain up (to protect the devotees). The lotus-eyed Lord bestows liberation.

lyrics:
Bhajo Madhura Hari Nam Nirantara Bhajo Madhura Hari Nam
Sarala Bhava Se Sai Bhajo
Madhura Bhava Se Baba Bhajo
Hari Hi Sukha Hai Hari Hi Shanti
Hari Prashanti Nivasi Ram
title: Bhajo Madhura Hari Nam
translation: Chant ceaselessly the sweet name of Hari and worship Sai with sweet simple thoughts. Hari who is Sai Ram resides in Prashanti Nilayam and provides comfort and peace.

lyrics:
Bhajo Manuva Bhajo Manuva Govinda Narayana
Govinda Narayana Gopala Narayana
Sai Gopala Narayana
Bhajo Manuva Bhajo Manuva Govinda Narayana
Ramaya Narayana
Krishnaya Narayana
Shri Sai Narayana
Sai Gopala Narayana
title: Bhajo Manuva Bhajo Manuva Govinda Narayana
translation: O mind, chant the different names of Lord Sai: Govinda, Narayana, Rama and Krishna.

lyrics:
Bhajo Radhe Govinda Bhajo Shyama Gopal
Shyama Gopal Bhajo Murali Gopal
Bhajo Radhe Govinda Bhajo Shyama Gopal
Keshava Narahari Shyama Gopal
Madhava Murahara Murali Gopal
title: Bhajo Radhe Govindha Bhajo Shyama Gopal
translation: Repeat the names of Krishna: beloved of Radha, dark-haired flute player, beautiful Keshava, God in human form, and slayer of the demon Mura.

lyrics:
Bhajo Sita Ram Bhajo Radhe Shyam
Govinda Gopala Sai Hare Nam
Keshava Madhava Radha Vallabha
Varada Narayana Nayanabhiram
Govinda Gopala Sai Hare Nam
title: Bhajo Sita Ram Bhajo Radhe Shyam
translation: Sing the glory of Sita Ram and Radhe Shyam (Krishna); of Govinda, Gopala, Madhava, Keshava; of Narayana, bestower of wishes; of Rama, who is to behold.

lyrics:
Bhajore Bhai Sai Ram
Parthipurisha Sai Ram
Bhajore Bhai Sai Ram
Dwarakamayi Sai Ram
Sada Sukhadayi Sai Ram
Shirdipurisha Sai Ram
Puttaparthipurisha Sai Ram
title: Bhajore Bhai Sai Ram
translation: Worship Lord Sai Ram, Lord of Puttaparthi, and of Dwarakamayi (Lord of Shirdi). He always grants happiness to all.

lyrics:
Bhajore Bhajo Sai Hare Ram
Govinda Gopala Sai Hare Ram
Madhava Mohana Sai Hare Ram
Bhajore Bhajo Sai Hare Ram
Shri Madhusudhana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
Hari Premanand Se Bolo Ram Hare Ram
Govinda Gopala Sai Hare Ram
Madhava Mohana Sai Hare Ram
title: Bhajore Bhajo Sai Hare Ram
translation: Let us sing to Sai who is Rama, Govinda and Gopala; to enchanting Lord Krishna, the destroyer of the demon Madhu. He removes the fear of birth and death.

lyrics:
Bhajore Manva Baba Nam
Bhakta Jano Ke Bhagwan
Bhajore Manva Baba Nam
Prema Pradayaka Bhagwan
Bhagavan Bhagavan
Prema Pradayaka Bhagwan
Partipurishwara Bhagwan
title: Bhajore Manva Baba Nam
translation: O mind, chant Baba's name. He is the Lord of His devotees and the Lord of Parthi. He endows us with love and devotion.

lyrics:
Bhajore Manva Sadgurudeva
Parama Krupalu Sai Mahadeva
Nisa Din Dhyan Karu Main Tera
Janam Janam Ka Mite Andhera
Parabrahma Parameshvara Rupa
Parabrahma Parameshvara Deva
Parama Krupalu Sai Mahadeva
title: Bhajore Manva Sadgurudeva
translation: O Mind chant the name of the ever-merciful true Guru Sai. Day and night I meditate upon your name, O Sai, to destroy my ignorance during each and every birth.

lyrics:
Bhajore Sada Bhajo Ram Kr'shna Govinda
Bhajo Hare Dina Bandhu Kr'shna Rama Govinda
Bhajore Anatha Natha Sai Rama Govinda
Bhajo Hare Dina Bandhu Kr'shna Rama Govinda
title: Bhajore Sada Bhajo Ram Krishna Govindha
translation: Always chant the name of Rama, Krishna, Govinda, and Sai Ram. He is the shelter for the meek and the uplifter of the helpless.

lyrics:
Bhakta Vatsala Tero Nam Sai
Duhkha Bhanjana Tero Nam Sai
Tum Sanga Bandhi Prem Ki Dori
Charaname Bandhi Prem Ki Dori
Sumirana Karun Tere Nam O Sai
Patitoddharana Bhakta Parayana
Partishvara Sai Ram
title: Bhakta Vatsala Tero Nam Sai
translation: Lord Sai, You are the guardian of devotees, and the dispeller of miseries. Please attach our string of love to Your feet. Singing Your name redeems all miseries of the destitute and protects the devotees.

lyrics:
Bhakto Ne Hai Aj Pukara
Ham Ne Pukara Baba Sab Ne Pukara
Dedo Dedo Hum Ko Sahara
Ana Hi Padega Baba Ana Hi Padega (2)
Ana Hi Padega (2)
Shirdi Se Ao Chahe Parthi Se Ao
Mathura Se Ao Ya Ayodhya Se Ao
Mecca Se Ao Ya Medina Se Ao
O Mere Maula O Mere Sai Tum Kahi Se Bhi Ao
title: Bhakto Ne Hai Aj Pukara
translation: Baba, all of Your devotees are beckoning You to come from wherever You are (Shirdi, Parthi, Mathura, Ayodhya, Mecca, or Medina) to help and support us.

lyrics:
Bhasma Bhushitanga Sai Chandra Shekara
Phala Nethra Shuladhari Sai Shankara
Bhasma Bhushitanga Sai Chandra Shekara
Sama Gana Priyakara Sai Shankara
Hara Hara Hara Shiva Shambo Nata Nateshwara
Parthivasa Sai Deva Sai Shankara
Sai Shankara Sathya Sai Shankara
title: Bhasma Bhushitanga Sai Chandra Shekara
translation: Worship Lord Sai Shiva, who is adorned with sacred holy ash. He wears the moon on His head, has the third spiritual eye on His forehead, and holds the Trident. He is Lord Shiva, a lover of dance and soothing music, and resides in Parthi

lyrics:
Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana Shesha Sayana Hari
Pranava Swaroopa Narayana
Rajiva Lochana Adi Sanathana
Bandha Vimochana Narayana
Padmanabha Prabhu Kamala Manohara
Vaikunta Pathe Narayana (2)
Pranava Swaroopa Narayana
title: Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana Shesha Sayana Hari
translation: Lord Hari, who is resting in a serpent coil, removes the fear of wordly existence. The eternal Lotus-eyed Lord Narayana, is the embodiment of life-force (Pranava). Adorned with a beautiful lotus on His navel, He resides in the highest abode (Vaikunta).

lyrics:
Bhava Bhaya Harana Vandita Charana
Jaya Radha Jaya Madhava Sai
Mangala Charana Kalimala Dahana
Narayana Keshava (Sai)
Jaya Radha Jaya Madhava Sai
title: Bhava Bhaya Harana Vandhitha Charana
translation: Salutations to You, O Lord Sai Madhava! The touch of Your adorable and auspicious lotus feet destroys bondage and burns the impurities of this Kali age.

lyrics:
Bhava Nasha Puttaparthi Pureesha
Jaya Shiva Shankara Jaya Paramesha
Mruthyunjaya Shiva Shaila Girisha
Mohana Kara Mana Moha Vinasha
Jyothi Prakasha Sathya Saisha
Jaya Shiva Shankara Jaya Paramesha
title: Bhava Nasha Puttaparthi Pureesha
translation: Glory to the Lord of Puttaparthi, who removes the cycle of rebirth. Glory to the eternal Shiva, the Lord of the mountains, who destroys desires. Glory to Lord Sathya Sai, Lord of theUniverse, engulfed in divine splendor.

lyrics:
Bhola Bhandari Baba Shiva Shiva Shiva Sai Baba
Anatha Rakshaka Dina Dayala Patita Pavana Sai Baba
Bhola Bhandari Baba Shiva Shiva Shiva Sai Baba
Yogeshvara Sai Murari Yogeshvara He Tripurari
Nityananda Brahmananda Premananda Sai Baba
title: Bhola Bhandari Baba
translation: Lord Sai Baba is the supporter, sustainer and shelter of the fallen and miserable ones. Chant the names of Lord Yogeshvara, Shiva, Sai, and Murari, who are ever blissful, happy and loving.

lyrics:
Bhola Jai Bhola Jai Satya Sai Ki Jai Bolo Satya Sai Ki Jai
Rama Krishna Jai, Pavana Purusha Jai Bolo Narayana Ki Jai
Bhola Jai Bhola Jai Satya Sai Ki Jai Bolo Satya Sai Ki Jai
Sanathana Dharma Uddharaka Sai Apadhbhandhava Govinda Sai
Ishvaramba Priyasuta Sai Satya Sai Ki Jai Bolo Satya Sai Ki Jai
title: Bhola Jai Bhola Jai Satya Sai Ki Jai
translation: Salutations to Sathya Sai, the incarnation of Narayana, who was born as Rama and Krishna. Upholder of the ancient and timeless values, Sai is the friend of those in trouble, and the darling son of mother Easvaramma.

lyrics:
Bhola Nath Hare Jagadisha
Shaileshvara Hara Uma Mahesha
Bhola Nath Hare Jagadeesha
Bhava Bhaya Hari He Tripurari
Shiva Gangadhara Sai Murari
Bhola Nath Bhola Nath
Sai Nath Sai Nath
title: Bhola Nath Hare Jagadisha
translation: Chant the names of the easy-to-please Lord of the Universe, Lord Shiva, the Lord of the Saila mountains and consort of Uma. He has the Holy Ganges in His matted hair and destroys the fear of the cycle of birth and death.

lyrics:
Bolo Bolo Sab Mil Bolo Om Namah Shivaya
Om Namah Shivaya Om Namah Shivaya
Bolo Bolo Sab Mil Bolo Om Namah Shivaya
Jhuta Jata Me Gangadhari
Trishuladhari Damaru Bajave
Dama Dama Dama Dama Damaru Baja
Gunj Utha Om Namah Shivaya
Om Namah Shivaya (4)
title: Bolo Bolo Sab Mil Bolo Om Namah Shivaya
translation: Chant in worship of Lord Shiva and surrender to Him. He bears the Ganges in His twisted lock of hair. He holds the trident and his drum (damaru) plays ""Dama Dama"". The atmosphere echoes with Shiva's name.

lyrics:
Bolo Jai Jai Kaar Bolo Jai Jai Kaar
Bolo Jai Jai Kaar Sai Baba Ki
Pathitha Pavana He Ghana Shyama
Sai Gopala He Ghana Shyama
Prema Bhagwan Sai Bhagwan
Sai Ram Sai Ram (2)
title: Bolo Jai Jai Kaar Bolo Jai Jai Kaar
translation: Sing out in praise of Sai Baba, the sanctifier of the fallen. Sai is the dark-complexioned Krishna, the protector of devotees, who is Love incarnate.

lyrics:
Bolo Narayana Jai Jai Vitthala
Sai Narayana Ranga Ranga Vitthala
Bolo Narayana Jai Jai Vitthala
Govinda Krishna Nam Rakhumayi Vitthala
Gopala Krishna Nam Panduranga Vitthala
Shri Ranga Vitthala Sai Ranga Vitthala
title: Bolo Narayana Jai Jai Vitthala
translation: Sing the glory of Narayan, Vitthala, the Lord of Rakhumayi and Krishna, now incarnated as Sai.

lyrics:
Brahmanda Nayaka Baba Partipurishwara Baba
Chand Aur Suraj Tumne Banayi
Nadiya Sagar Tumne Banayi (2)
Brahmanda Nayaka Baba Partipurishwara Baba
Ayodhya Nagari Tumne Banayi Dwaraka Nagari Tumne Banayi
Shirdi Parthi Tumne Basayi
title: Brahmanda Nayaka Baba Partipurishwara Baba
translation: Baba, the Lord of the city of Parthi, creator of the moon, sun, rivers and oceans, and the cities of Ayodhya and Dwaraka, is also established in Shirdi and Parthi.

lyrics:
Chanda Kirana Kula Mandana Ram
Shrimad Dasharatha Nandhana Ram
Kaushalya Sukha Vardhana Ram
Vishwamithra Priya Dhana Ram
title: Chanda Kirana Kula Mandana Ram
translation: Lord Rama, the adornment of the Solar dynasty, and the beloved son of King Dasharatha, filled Mother Kaushalya's heart with bliss. He was the beloved treasure of Sage Vishwamithra.

lyrics:
Chandra Shekaraya Namah Om
Ganga Dharaya Namah Om
Chandra Shekaraya Namah Om
Om Namah Shivaya Namah Om
Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om
Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
Saishwaraya Namah Om
title: Chandra Shekaraya Namah Om
translation: Obeisance to Lord Shiva, Who is decorated with the crescent - moon on His forehead and who makes the celestial holy Ganges flow through His matted hair. I bow to Lord Sai Shiva, Who destroys the miseries of life. Chant the names of Shiva.

lyrics:
Chandravadana Kamala Nayana
Narayana Sai Narayana
Ananta Shayana Dina Sharanya
Narayana Sai Narayana
title: Chandravadana Kamala Nayana
translation: Lord Sai Narayana has a face like the cool moon and eyes like lotus flowers. He sleeps on Shesha, the king of serpents. He is the protector of the poor and troubled.

lyrics:
Chitta Chora Murali Vala
Nandalala Nanda Gopala
Nandalala Nandalala
Brindavana Shyama Gopala
Mathura Vraja Gokula Bala
Mana Mohana Madana Gopala
Nandalala Nandalala
Nandalala Nanda Gopala
Nandalala Nandalala
title: Chitta Chora Murali Vala
translation: Chant the many names of Lord Krishna: the enchanting flute player, the beloved son of Nanda, Who resides in Brindavan, captivator of one's mind and stealer of the heart. He is the one who lived as a cowherd in Mathura, Vraja and Gokula.

lyrics: Chitta Chora Yashoda Ke Bal Navanitha Chora Gopal\nGopal Gopal Gopal Govardhana Dhara Gopal\nGopal Gopal Gopal Gopal Govardhana Dhara Gopal
title: Chitta Chora Yashoda Ke Bal
translation: Krishna is the stealer of the devotee's heart. As the child of Yashoda, He stole butter and He held aloft the Govardhana mountain

lyrics:
Chitta Raja Chitta Raja
Brindavana Ghana Mangala Charana
Savari Surat Dinoddharana
Partipurishvara Chitta Raja Chitta Raja
Rupa Manohara Murali Madhuvana
Partipurishvara Chitta Raja Chitta Raja
title: Chitta Raja Chitta Raja
translation: Surrender at the auspicious feet of Lord Sai, King of one's heart and resident of Brindavan. The enchanting flute player, with the dark and compassionate face, protects the poor and helpless and resides in Puttaparthi.

lyrics:
Dam Dam Dam Dam Damaru Bhaje
Bhola Nath Shiva Shambo Bhaje
Ghana Ghana Ghana Ghana Ghanta Bhaje
Gauri Nath Shiva Shambo Bhaje
Hara Sai Nath Shiva Shambo Bhaje
title: Dam Dam Dam Dam Damaru Bhaje
translation: Chant the names of Lord Shiva and Sai to the rhythm of the drums and the peal of the bells.

lyrics:
Dama Dama Damaru Damaru Natha Shiva
Dhimitha Dhimitha Dhimi Gauri Natha Shiva
Dama Dama Damaru Damaru Natha Shiva
Natana Manohara Nataraja Shiva
Hara Hara Bham Bham Bhole Natha Shiva
Shambo Shankara Vishwanatha Shiva
Shivaya Namah Shiva Sainatha Shiva
title: Dama Dama Damaru Damaru Natha Shiva
translation: The king of dance, Lord Shiva, loves the sound of the Damaru (Drum). Chant the name of the easy to please Lord Shiva, and of Lord Sai.

lyrics:
Danava Bhanjana Rama Sai Shyamala Komala Ram
Hey Rama Rama Jaya Rama Sai Rama Rama Ram
Danava Bhanjana Rama Sai Shyamala Komala Ram
Dasharatha Nandana Rama Sai Daya Sagara Ram
Dino(n) Ke Prabhu Rama Sai Rama Rama Ram
title: Danava Bhanjana Rama Sai
translation: Rama, the tender natured, dark-complexioned destroyer of demons, is Sai. Sing the praise of Sai, and Rama, Dasharatha's Son. He is an ocean of mercy and the Lord of the helpless.

lyrics:
Darshana Dijo Bhagwan
Parama Dayalu Bhagwan
Darshana Dijo Bhagwan
Adhi Anantha Adbutha Rupa
Ananda Datha Ashritha Vatsala
Prema Swarupa Shanti Pradhatha
Sachithananda Shri Satya Saisha
title: Darshana Dijo Bhagwan
translation: Sai, Lord of compassion and infinite mercy, please grant us Your divine vision. Sai, the eternal and marvellous form of love, truth, knowledge and bliss, grants eternal happiness and peace to those devoted to Him.

lyrics:
Darshana Do Prabhu Darshana Do
Darshana Do Mujhe Sai Bhagwan
Vinati Karu Mein Bar Bar Sai
Darshana Do Prabhu Darshana Do
Hrudaya Mein Aao Sai Bhagwan
Bhajan Mein Aao Sai Bhagwan
Nayan Mein Aao Sai Bhagwan
Dhyan Mein Aao Sai Bhagwan
Sai Bhagwan Sai Bhagwan
Parthi Puri Ke Sai Bhagwan
Darshana Do Mujhe Sai Bhagwan
title: Darshana Do Prabhu Darshana Do
translation: Lord Sai, the resident of Parthi, grant us Your divine vision. Please come in our hearts, in our prayers, and in our meditation.

lyrics:
Dasharatha Nandana Raja Rama
Janaki Jivana Shree Raghu Rama
Dasharatha Nandana Raja Rama
Rama Rama Ravi Kula Soma
Ravana Mardhana Kodhanda Rama
title: Dasharatha Nandana Raja Rama
translation: O Son of Dasaratha, King Rama O Life-breath of mother Janaki O Moon of the Ravi (Sun) clan O Slayer of the demon-king Ravana O wielder of the bow.

lyrics:
Dasharatha Nandana Rama Daya Sagara Rama
Raghukula Tilaka Rama Satya Sai Shri Param Dhama
Dasharatha Nandana Rama Daya Sagara Rama
Ahalyoddharaka Rama Papa Vimochana Rama
Shirdi Purisha Rama Puttaparthipuri Param Dhama
title: Dasharatha Nandana Rama Daya Sagara Rama
translation: Chant the name of Lord Rama, ocean of mercy and jewel of the Raghu dynasty. He is the compassionate one who liberated Ahalya from her sin. He is also Lord Sai of Shirdi and Puttaparthi.

lyrics:
Dasharathe Rama Jaya Jaya Rama
Raghu Kula Bhushana Raja Rama
Dasharathe Rama Jaya Jaya Rama
Sita Vallabha Sundara Rama
Shri Rama Jaya Rama Satya Sai Rama
title: Dasharathe Rama Jaya Jaya Rama
translation: Salutations to Lord Rama, son of Dasharatha, the handsome consort of Sita. He is the adornment of the Raghu dynasty.

lyrics:
Daya Karo Hari Narayana
Krupa Karo He Jagat Vandana
Daya Karo Hari Narayana
Bhavatita Bhagya Vidhata
Dina Natha Anatho Ke Natha
title: Daya Karo Hari Narayana
translation: Shower mercy and compassion on us, Narayana, the Lord of the helpless and the forsaken. You are the One worshipped by the whole world, who bestows good fortune and transcends worldly existence.

lyrics:
Daya Sagara Karunakara
Jagadishvara Saishvara
Bhuvaneshvara Akhileshvara
Guna Gambhira Saishvara
title: Daya Sagara Karunakara
translation: Lord Sai, who is an ocean of mercy and compassion, is the all-pervading Lord of entire creation. He is filled with all virtuous qualities.

lyrics:
Daya Sudha Barsao Matha
Jaya Jaya Jaya Ambe
Prema Sudha Barsao Matha
Jaya Jaya Jaya Ambe
Devi Niranjani Sai Bhavani
Jaya Jaya Jaya Ambe (2)
title: Daya Sudha Barsao Matha
translation: Shower us with the nectar of your compassion and love, Mother Goddess Sai. Salutations to You, the Goddess of Purity (consort of Shiva), and remover of the woes of worldly existence.

lyrics:
Deva Devotthama Dina Samrakshaka
Devadhi Deva Dhaya Maya
Shri Sai Deva Krupa Maya
Pathithoddhara Papavidhura
Parthi Vihara Parameshwara
Bhasmodbhavakara Bhava Bhaya Nashana
Shri Sai Deva Krupa Maya
title: Deva Devotthama Dina Samrakshaka
translation: Lord Sai, the supreme among Gods, is the protector of the afflicted, the Lord of all Lords. He bestows grace, uplifts the fallen and miserable, and destroys our sins. He creates Vibhuthi, (sacred ash, symbol of detachment), and removes the fear of the bondage of birth and death.

lyrics:
Devaki Tanaya Daya Nidhe
Daya Nidhe Kr'pa Nidhe
Devaki Tanaya Daya Nidhe
Darshan Dijo Deva Deva (2)
Darshan Dijo Sai Deva
Dina Natha Sai Natha
title: Devaki Tanaya Daya Nidhe
translation: O son of Devaki, full of compassion! Please give us Your Darshan, O Lord of Lords, Sai Baba, the Lord who looks after the ones in need.

lyrics:
Devi Bhavani Ma Jaya Sai Bhavani Ma
Daya Karo Sai Ma Kr'pa Karo Sai Ma
Jaya Ma Jaya Ma Jaya Devi Bhavani Ma
Jaya Parthi Nivasini Ma Jaya Sai Bhavani Ma
title: Devi Bhavani Ma Jaya Sai Bhavani Ma
translation: Victory to Goddess Bhavani, Sai Bhavani! O Mother Sai, bestow Thy Grace on us and lead us on the spiritual path. May You be victorious in this task.

lyrics:
Devi Sai Ma Devi Saraswathi Ma
Durga Bhavani Ma Kali Kapalini Ma
Jagadoddharini Ma
Devi Daya Karo Ma
Sathya Sai Daya Karo Ma
title: Devi Sai Ma Devi Saraswathi Ma
translation: Have mercy on us, Mother Sai, Goddess of knowledge and wisdom. You are the destroyer of the cycle of birth and death and of demonic qualities, and protector of the Universe.

lyrics:
Dhim Dhim Dhimi Dhimi Natana Shiva
Tandava Kheli Vilasa Shiva
Lila Manusha Vesha Shiva
Lingodbhavakara Sai Shiva (Atma)
Sai Shiva Hara Bala Shiva
title: Dhim Dhim Dhimi Dhimi Natana Shiva
translation: Shiva, dancing to the rhythmical sound of ""dhim, dhim, dhimi, dhimi"", while performing the cosmic dance, has disguised Himself in human form as Sai. Sai, who brings forth the lingam, is Shiva (or Hara), the destroyer.

lyrics:
Dhimiki Dhimiki Dhim Dhimiki Dhimiki Dhim Nache Bhola Nath
Nache Bhola Nath (4)
Mrudanga Bole Shiva Shiva Shiva Om
Damaru Bole Hara Hara Hara Om
Veena Bole Sai Ram Sai Ram
Nache Bhola Nath (4)
title: Dhimiki Dhimiki Dhim
translation: Lord Shiva dances in ecstacy to rhythmic music and the sound of the drums, and the vibrations of the veena. These musical instruments seem to reverberate the name of Sai Ram.

lyrics:
Dina Bandhava Shri Sai Deva
Daya Sagara Devadhi Deva
Dina Bandhava Shri Sai Deva
Pahi Prabho Saishwara
Dehi Vibho Jagadhishwara
Sharanam Prabho Sathya Sai Deva
title: Dina Bandhava Shri Sai Deva
translation: Sai is the kinsman of the dejected and the afflicted. He is the Lord of Lords, and ocean of mercy. Sai, You are the Lord of the Universe in human form. Kindly protect me. I surrender to you.

lyrics:
Dina Dukhio Se Prem Karo mera Sai Prasanna Hoga
Prem Karo Prem Karo Mera Sai Prasanna Hoga
Sai Mera Mai Tera Ye Prem Ki Behati Dhara
Ye Prem Ki Behati Dhara (2)
Mera Sai Prasanna Hoga
title: Dina Dukhio Se Prem Karo
translation: Lord Sai be very pleased if we love and serve those afflicted with miseries and pain. Love will bind us with Lord Sai and Him with us.

lyrics:
Dina Natha Shankara
Karuna Sagara Shankara
Partipurishvara Shankara (2)
Bhola Natha Kailasa Vasa
Partipurishvara He Paramesha
Saishvara Deva
title: Dina Natha Shankara
translation: Chant the name of Lord Shankara, who is the protector of the miserable and afflicted. He is the ocean of compassion, the resident of Kailasa Mountain, and is the Lord of Lords Sai, residing in Parthi.

lyrics:
Don't Worry, Be Happy, for Baba loves Us So
Illusions Are Many, but Underneath Them All
There Is One Reality That You and I Are One
That God Is Love and Love Is God and God and Man Are One
title: Don't Worry, Be Happy, For Baba Loves Us All
translation: None

lyrics:
Door of My Heart Open Wide I keep for Thee
Wilt Thou come (2) precious Baba, Come to Me
Door of My Heart Open Wide I keep for Thee
Will My Days Fly Away Without Seeing Thee My Lord
Night and Day, Night and Day, I Look for Thee Night and Day
Wilt Thou come (2) precious Baba, Come to Me
title: Door Of My Heart Open Wide I Keep For Thee
translation: None

lyrics:
Durga Bhavani Ma Jaya Jaya Sai Ma
Kali Kapalini Ma Jaya Jaya Sai Ma
Durga Bhavani Ma Jaya Jaya Sai Ma
Parama Shivani Ma Jaya Jaya Sai Ma
Jagadoddharini Ma Jaya Jaya Sai Ma (2)
title: Durga Bhavani Ma Jaya Jaya Sai Ma
translation: Salutations to Mother Sai in the form of Durga, Bhavani, and Kali, who is supreme energy, and is the savior of the World.

lyrics:
Ek Bar Kshama Karo Sai Mere Baba Shri Sathya Sai
Kshama Murthi Sai Baba Prema Murthi Sathya Sai
Ek Bar Kshama Karo Sai Mere Baba Shri Sathya Sai
Shirdi Ke Sai Teri Dwarakamayi
Parthi Ke Sai Teri Yad Mujhe Ayi
Kshama Murthi Sai Baba Prema Murthi Sathya Sai
title: Ek Bar Kshama Karo Sai Mere Baba Shri Sathya Sai
translation: O Lord Sai, embodiment of forgiveness, love and mercy, please forgive me once. Let me remember You, Lord of Shirdi, Parthi and Dwaraka.

lyrics:
Eshwaramba Priya Nandana
Sai Jaya Jaga Vandana (2)
Ishwaramba Priya Nandana
Ratnakara Kula Bhushana
Rajiva Nayana Narayana
Narayana Sai Narayana (2)
title: Eshwaramba Priya Nandana
translation: The whole world pays obeisance to the beloved son of Mother Eshwaramma, Lord Sai. The jewel of Ratnakara dynasty is the lotus-eyed Lord Narayana.

lyrics:
Every Moment of My Life Please Be with Me
In Every Single Act of Mine Be Thou My Guide
Baba Sai Baba
When I Slip When I Fall Lend Me a Hand
When I Stray Far Away Bring Me Back Again
Baba Sai Baba
From the Darkness into Light Lead Me, Father
From the Unreal into the Real
Baba Sai Baba (2)
title: Every Moment Of My Life Please Be With Me
translation: None

lyrics:
Gajanana Gajanana
Prathama Pujana Ganaraya
Prathama Prarthana Shri Ganaraya
Lambodhara Ganaraya
title: Gajanana Gajanana
translation: At the outset, pray to and worship the elephant-faced Lord Ganesha, the pot-bellied leader of the Ganas.

lyrics:
Gajanana He Ganapathi Deva
Siddhi Vinayaka Mangala Dhatha
Gajanana He Ganapathi Deva
Gajamukha Rupa Sai Ganesha
Moksha Pradhayaka Hey Gananatha
Papa Vidhoora Bhava Bhaya Hara
Vighna Vinashaka Vinayaka
Vijaya Gajanana Vinayaka
title: Gajanana He Ganapathi Deva
translation: O elephant headed Lord Ganesha, you are the bestower of auspiciousness and realization. O Lord Sai, you are the Lord Ganesha who is the remover of sins and bestower of liberation. You are the remover of obstacles and the bestower of victory, O Lord Ganesha.

lyrics:
Gajanana He Shubhanana
Gauri Manohara Priya Nandana
Pashupathi Tanaya Gajanana
Parama Niranjana Shubhanana
He Parama Niranjana Shubhanana
title: Gajanana He Shubhanana
translation: Elephant-faced Lord Ganesha, who bestows good luck, is the heart's delight of Mother Gauri; the son of Shiva, ruler of all living creatures, is Supreme Purity.

lyrics:
Gajavadana Gananatha Gajavadana Dinanatha
Siddhi Data Shiva Tanaya
Buddhi Pradayaka Gajanana
Parvati Nandana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
Yuga Yuga Vandita Jaya Shri Ganesha
title: Gajavadhana Gananatha Gajavadhana Dinanatha
translation: Worship the elephant-faced Lord Gajanana, the Lord of demi-gods. The son of Lord Shiva and Mother Parvati who bestows success and removes the fear of crossing the ocean of life and death, is worshipped during all yugas (ages).

lyrics:
Gana Natha Gana Natha
Mushika Vahana Jaya Gana Natha
Charanam Sharanam Gajanana
Gana Natha Gana Natha
Siddhi Vinayaka Gana Natha
Mukti Pradayaka Gana Natha
Jagadoddhara Jaya Gana Natha
Charanam Sharanam Gajanana
title: Gajavadhana Gananatha Natha
translation: Take refuge at the feet of Lord Ganesha whose conveyance is the mouse and who protects the universe and bestows liberation. The leader of the Ganas is perfection itself and removes obstacles.

lyrics:
Gajavadhana Gananatha Natha
Gauri Vara Thanaya Gunalaya
Gajavadhana Gananatha Natha
Vidya Dhayaka Buddhi Pradhayaka
Siddhi Vinayaka He Shubha Dhayaka
title: Gana Natha Gana Natha
translation: The elephant-faced Lord who is the master of all the Ganas is the beloved son of Lord of Gauri (Shiva). He is the embodiment of virtues and bestower of knowledge and intellect. Lord Vinayaka who is perfection himself bestows auspiciousness.

lyrics:
Gana Natha Sai Gajanana
Partishvara Duhkha Bhanjana
Gana Natha Sai Gajanana
Kailasa Pate Shiva Nandana
Dina Nath Hare He Niranjana
Buddhi Pradata Shubanana
Jagadishvara Shanti Niketana (2)
title: Gana Natha Sai Gajanana
translation: Chant the name of the leader of the Ganas (Ganesha), Lord of Parthi, destroyer of grief, son of the Lord of Kailasa mountain (Shiva) and Lord of the afflicted; he is Truth, bestows knowledge and auspiciousness, and is the Lord of the Universe and the abode of peace.

lyrics:
Ganapathi Om Jaya Ganapathi Om
Gajamukha Varadha Ganapathi Om
Mushika Vahana Gajanana
Modaka Hastha Gajanana
Parama Niranjana Gajanana
Pada Namaste Gajanana
title: Ganapathi Om Jaya
translation: Salutations to the Lord of Ganas, the elephant-faced Ganesha, bestower of wishes. Bow at the feet of Ganesha, who rides a mouse, has a sweet in His hands and is ever pure.

lyrics:
Ganesha Sharanam Parama Pavanam Sathya Sainam Gajananam
Nithya Smaranam Parama Pavanam Sathya Sainam Gajananam
Sadguru Charanam Parama Pavanam Sathya Sainam Gajananam
Bhava Bhaya Haranam Parama Pavanam Sathya Sainam Gajananam
title: Ganesha Sharanam Parama Pavanam
translation: Bow in reverence to Sai and to Ganesh, the elephant-faced God of purity. Constantly remember the purifying name of Sai, the destroyer of fears, and bow at Guru's feet.

lyrics:
Ganga Jatadhara Gauri Mahesha
Shiva Shiva Shankara Shaila Girisha
Ganga Jatadhara Gauri Mahesha
Parvathi Ramana Pahi Mahesha
Pahi Mahesha Hey Paramesha
Parthipurishwara Sai Sarvesha
title: Ganga Jatadhara Gauri Mahesha
translation: Lord of Gauri (Shiva) who holds the Ganges in His matted hair, is the Lord of Parthi, and the compassionate Lord of Lords, residing in Puttaparthi.

lyrics:
Ganga Jatadhara Gauri Shankara Girija Mana Ramana (Jaya)
Mruthyunjaya Mahadeva Maheshwara Mangala Shubha Charana
Nandhi Vahana Naga Bhushana
Nirupama Guna Sadhana
Natana Manohara Nilakantha Sai
Niraja Dala Nayana
title: Ganga Jatadhara Gauri Shankara Girija Mana Ramana
translation: Salutations to Lord Shiva who holds Ganga in His matted hair. He is the Lord of Gauri, the immortal One, and is the divine dancer who has Nandhi as His vehicle. He who is adorned with serpents around His blue neck, is the repository of incomparable qualities.

lyrics:
Garuda Vahana Narayana
He Shesha Sayana Narayana
Garuda Vahana Narayana
Shri Lakshmi Ramana Narayana (2)
Hari Om Hari Om Narayana
title: Garuda Vahana Narayana
translation: Chant the name of Lord Narayana, who has an eagle as His vehicle and reclines on the coiled serpent. He is the consort of Goddes Lakshmi and the embodiment of Om.

lyrics:
Gauri Nandana Bala Gajanana
Gajavadana Gana Natha Gajanana
Maha Ganapate Sai Gajanana
Gajanana Sai Gajanana
title: Gauri Nandana Bala Gajanana
translation: The elephant-faced son of Mother Gauri, the exalted leader of the Ganas is Gajanana (Ganesha).

lyrics:
Gauri Nandana Gajanana
Girija Nandana Niranjana
Parvathi Nandana Shubanana
Pahi Prabho Mam Pahi Prasanna
title: Gauri Nandana Gajanana
translation: O Lord Ganesha, son of Mother Gauri, kindly protect us and bestow us with good luck.

lyrics:
Gauri Nathaya Vishwa Nathaya Sai Nathaya Namah Shivaya
Gunathithaya Gunadharaya Gunarnavaya Namah Shivaya
Kala Kalaya Kalathithaya Kala Roopaya Namah Shivaya
Prema Rupaya Parthi Vasaya Sai Babaya Namah Shivaya
title: Gauri Nathaya Vishwa Nathaya
translation: Bow to Lord Shiva, Lord of Gauri and Lord of the Universe, who is full of vituous qualities. He is above all qualities; He is the embodiment of Time and transcends time; He is the personification of Love and resides in Parthi.

lyrics:
Gauri Sutaya Om Namah Om
Lambhodharaya Om Namah Om
Vighneshvaraya Om Namah Om
Bhava Dukha Bhanjana Om Namah Om
title: Gauri Sutaya Om Namah Om
translation: We bow to Parvati's pot-bellied son, remover of obstacles and destroyer of worldy sorrows. Ganesha is the personification of Om.

lyrics:
Gentle Lord We Crave the Bliss of Your Darshan
Swami Come Let Your Radiance Surround Us Touching Everyone
You Are the Path and the Goal
Teach Us to Follow You Faithfully
You Give the Life to the Soul
May We Be Blessed with the Grace of Sai Fully Immersed in Him
title: Gentle Lord We Crave The Bliss Of Your Darshan
translation: None

lyrics:
Ghana Shyama Sundara
Bansidhara Prabhu Krishna Kanhaiya
Thu Hi Mere Ma Bap Bhaiya
Ghana Shyama Sundara
Devaki Thanaya He Nandalala
Dina Bandhava Dwaraka Natha
Radha Hrudhaya Nivasa Hare Krishna
Madhusudhana He Muralidhara
Parthishwara Sathya Saishwara
title: Ghana Shyama Sundara
translation: The dark-hued Lord Krishna, son of Devaki and Nanda, is the charming flute-player and resident of the heart of Radha. O Lord Krishna, You are our Mother, Father, and Brother. Lord of Dwaraka, kith and kin of the afflicted and miserable, is Lord Sathya Sai of Parthi

lyrics:
Giridhara Gopala He Giridhara Gopala He Giridhara Gopala
Mira Ke Prabhu Giridhara Nagara
Surdas Ke Shyama Manohara
Bhakto Ke Satya Sai Manohara
title: Giridhara Gopala He Giridhara Gopala
translation: Gopala, the cowherd boy, who held the mountain on His finger, is the Lord of His devotees, Meera and Surdas. Lord Sathya Sai enchants His devotees.

lyrics:
Giridhara Gopala Sai Giridhara Gopala
Parthipurishwara Sai Gopala (2)
Giridhara Gopala Sai Giridhara Gopala
Mira Ke Prabhu Giridhara Nagara
Pahi Mam Ghanashyama Shyama
Pahi Mam Ghanashyam
He Pahi Mam Ghana Shyama Shyama
title: Giridhara Gopala Sai Giridhara Gopala
translation: Lord Sai Gopala is the dweller of Parthi. Gopala, who held up the mountain, is the Lord of Meera (a devotee). O dark-complexioned Lord Krishna, please protect us.

lyrics:
Giridhari Jaya Giridhari
Sugandha Tulasi Dala Vanamali
Giridhari Jaya Giridhari
Munijana Sevita Madhava Murahara
Murali Manohara Giridhari
Gopi Manohara Giridhari
title: Giridhari Jaya Giridhari
translation: Glory to Lord Krishna, who held up the mountain Govardhana, and destroyed the demon Mura. He wears fragrant Tulasi (basil) leaves, and is the divine flute-player worshipped by sages. He is the delight of Gopis.

lyrics:
Giridhari Lal Shyama Gopal
Natavara Lal Madana Gopal
Mathura Natha Kr'shna Gopal
He Madhusudana Murali Gopal
Yashoda Ke Bal Nanda Gopal
Ishvaramba Priya Sai Gopal
title: Giridhari Lal Shyama Gopal
translation: Gopala, who held the mountain up, is the enchanting dancer. He is Lord of Mathura, who destroyed the demon Madhu. He is the divine flute-player, and the beloved son of Nanda and Yashoda. He has now incarnated as Sai, Eshwaramba's son.

lyrics:
Giridhari Murari Govinda
Ghanashyama Murari Gopala
Giridhari Murari Govinda
Radhe Krishna Murari Govinda
Satya Sai Murari Gopala
title: Giridhari Murari Govinda
translation: Lord Govinda, who held the mountain on His finger, is as dark as the darkest cloud. He, who destroyed the demon Mura, is the Lord of Radha. He is Lord Sathya Sai.

lyrics:
Gopala Gopala Nacho Gopala
Nacho Nacho Sai Nandalala (2)
Ruma Jhuma Ruma Jhuma Nacho Gopala
Nacho Nacho Sai Nandalala (2)
title: Gopala Gopala Nacho Gopala
translation: Please perform your enchanting dance, O Sai Gopala.

lyrics:
Gopala Radha Lola
Murali Lola Nandalala (Sai)
Gopala Radha Lola
Keshava Madhava Janardana
Vanamala Brindavana Bala
Murali Lola Nandalala
title: Gopala Radha Lola
translation: Chant the name of Lord Gopala, the divine flute-player of Brindavan, and beloved of Radha.

lyrics:
Govind Bolo Gopal Bolo
Ram Ram Bolo Hari Nam Bolo
Allah Malik Isha Nanak
Zoarastra Mahavir Buddha Nam Bolo
Govind Bolo Gopal Bolo
Ye Nam Sare Hai Jivan Sahare
Paramananand Ke Kholte Hai Dvare
Jo Nam Chaho Vo Nam Bolo
Prem Se Bolo Bhav Se Bolo
title: Govinda Bolo Gopala Bolo
translation: Sing the glorious names of Govinda, Gopala, Rama, Hari, Allah, Sai, Jesus, Nanak, Zoroaster, Mahavir, and Buddha. As companions in life, they open our hearts to supreme bliss. Chant the name you choose with love and devotion.

lyrics:
Govinda Bolo Guru Sai Bolo
Gopala Bolo Guru Sai Bolo
Govinda Bolo Guru Sai Bolo
Shiridi Sai Bolo Shiva Guru Nam Bolo
Satya Sai Bolo Sadguru Nam Bolo
Sai Ram sai Ram (2)
Prema Sai Bolo Parabrahma Bolo
Parthi Baba Bolo Paramatma Bolo
Sai Ram Sai Ram (2)
title: Govinda Bolo Guru Sai Bolo
translation: Chant the names of our teacher and creator of the Universe: Govinda (Krishna) Shiva, Sai of Shiridi, of Parthi, and Sai, the embodiment of love.

lyrics:
Govinda Gopala Hey Nandalala
Radhe Gopala Gopi Gopala
Mira Ke Natha Prabhu Murali Gopala
Govardhanoddhara Gopala Bala
Radhe Gopala Gopi Gopala
title: Govinda Gopala Hey Nandalala
translation: Chant the names of Lord Krishna: Govinda, Lord of Radha, Gopala, Lord of Meera and of Gopis. The flute-player is the cowherd boy Krishna.

lyrics: Govinda Govinda Gayiye Re Bhajo Radhe Gopala Krishna Gaiye Re\nMurali Manohara Gayiye Re Bhajo Nanda Ke Lal Prabhu Gaiye Re\nGiridhari Giridhari Gaiye Re Mayi Mira Ke Nath Prabhu Gaiye Re (2)
title: Govinda Govinda Gayiye Re Bhajo Radhe Gopala Krishna Gaiye Re
translation: Chant the names of Govinda: Gopala, Krishna, the enchanting flute player, Nanda's darling son, the Lord of Meera, and the one who carried the mountain aloft.

lyrics:
Govinda Hare Gopala Hare He Gopi Gopa Bala
Govinda Hare Gopala Hare He Murali Gana Lola
Govinda Hare Gopala Hare He Radha Ramana Lola
Govinda Hare Gopala Hare He Nanda Gopa Bala
title: Govinda Hare Gopala Hare
translation: Lord Govinda (Gopala) is the friend of the Gopis and Gopas and plays enchanting music on the flute. He is the beloved Lord of Radha and is the loving son of Nanda.

lyrics:
Govinda Krishna Vittale Venu Gopala Krishna Vittale
Ranga Ranga Vittale Shri Panduranga Vittale
Govinda Krishna Vittale Venu Gopala Krishna Vittale
Ranga Ranga Vittale Shri Panduranga Vittale
title: Govinda Krishna Vittale
translation: Chant the names of Lord Govinda, Lord Krishna with the flute, Lord Vitthala, and Lord Panduranga, all names of Krishna and Vishnu

lyrics:
Govinda Madhava Gopala Keshava
Jaya Nanda Mukunda Nanda Govinda Radhe Gopala
Govinda Madhava Gopala Keshava
Giridhari Giridhari Jaya Radhe Gopala
Ghanashyama Shyama Shayama Jai Jai Radhe Gopala
Jaya Nanda Mukunda Nanda Govinda Radhe Gopala
title: Govinda Madhava Gopala Keshava
translation: Glory to Krishna, the cowherd boy with divine powers; to Radha's Lord, with deep blue complexion, who protected his village from a deluge, by lifting a mountain.

lyrics:
Govinda Murahari Madhava
Govinda Gopala Keshava
Govinda Murahari Madhava
Janardana Sai Parthi Vihari
Govardhanoddhari Madhava
Madhava Keshava Hari Narayana
title: Govinda Murahari Madhava
translation: Govinda (Krishna), who destroyed the demon Mura, is the cowherd boy with beautiful hair. He protected His devotees from a deluge by lifting a mountain and He is Sai Narayana now living in Parthi.

lyrics:
Govinda Narayana Gopala Narayana
Govinda Govinda Narayana
Govinda Gopala Narayana
Govinda Govinda Narayana
Sai Govinda Gopala Narayana
title: Govinda Narayana Gopala Narayana
translation: Chant the names of Lord Govinda, Narayana, Gopala, and Sai

lyrics:
Govinda Radhe Krishna Govinda Govinda
Gopala Radhe Krishna Govinda Govinda
Govinda Radhe Krishna Govinda Govinda
Mohana Bala Krishna Govinda Govinda
Parthi Nivasa Krishna Govinda Govinda
title: Govinda Radhe Krishna Govinda Govinda
translation: Chant the names of the Lord: Govinda, the Lord of Radha (Lord Krishna); Gopala, the handsome boy Krishna and the Lord who resides in Parthi, Lord Sai

lyrics:
Govinda Rama Jai Jai Gopala Rama
Madhava Rama Jai Jai Keshava Rama
Govinda Rama Jai Jai Gopala Rama
Durlabha Rama Jai Jai Sulabha Rama
Eka Tu Rama Jai Jai Aneka Tu Rama
title: Govinda Rama Jai Jai Gopala Rama
translation: Victory to Lord Gopala, Govinda, Madhava, Keshava and Rama, the One Lord who incarnated and manifested as many. Lord Rama is difficult to realize, yet once realized, there is supreme bliss.

lyrics:
Guru Baba Guru Baba
Charana Namostute Guru Baba
Sai Baba Bala Baba
Satya Baba Prema Baba
Guruvara Guruvara Guru Baba
Vidya Dayaka Guru Baba
Shanta Svarupa Guru Baba
Prema Svarupa Guru Baba
Guruvara Guruvara Guru Baba
title: Guru Baba Guru Baba
translation: Worship and pay obeisance at the lotus feet of the most supreme, noble teacher, Lord Sai Baba. He is the embodiment of truth, love and peace. He grants spiritual knowledge.

lyrics:
Guru Bhagavan Sai Ram
Sadguru Natha Sai Bhagavan
Guru Bhagavan Sai Ram
Prashanti Nilaya Deena Dayala
Parthipurisha Parama Dayala
Sadguru Natha Sai Bhagavan (Sri)
title: Guru Bhagavan Sai Ram
translation: We bow to our Guru Lord Sairam. The Lord of Prashanthi, saviour of the destitute is our true Guru. The Lord of Parthi is the embodiment of Supreme compassion.

lyrics:
Guru Bhagwan Satya Sai Bhagwan
Prashanti Nivasa Sai Bhagwan
Guru Bhagwan Satya Sai Bhagwan
Dharmoddharaka Sai Bhagwan
Sadguru Natha Sai Bhagwan
Mama Guru Natha Sai Bhagwan
title: Guru Bhagwan Satya Sai Bhagwan
translation: O Lord Sathya Sai, the Supreme Guru, who lives in Prashanti, is the upholder of righteousness, You are my Guru.

lyrics:
Guru Brahma Guru Vishnu Guru Devo Maheshvara
Guru Sakshat Para Bramha Tasmai Shri Gurave Namah
Jai Jai Jai Akhileshvara
Jai Jai Jai Bhuvaneshvara
Jai Jai Jai Partishvara
Jai Jai Jai Saishvara
title: Guru Brahma Guru Vishnu
translation: The Preceptor (guru) is Brahma, Vishnu, and the highest Lord God. Glory to God, the preceptor and the infinite Lord of the Universe, Lord Sai of Parthi.

lyrics:
Guru Deva Guru Govinda
Mandara Giridhara Shirdi Maheshwara
Jaya Parthishwara Sai Kripala
Guru Deva Guru Govinda
Sundara Rupa Shri Sai Deva
Vaidhehi Mohana Narayana
title: Guru Deva Guru Govinda
translation: Glory to the Lord of Shirdi and Parthi Glory to Lord Vishnu, the benevolent teacher whose beautiful form enchanted Vaidehi (Lakshmi)

lyrics:
Guru Deva Priya Deva Sai Deva Dhaya Maya
Vibhuthi Sundara Shashanka Shekara
Sai Shankara Dhaya Karo
Guru Deva Priya Deva Sai Deva Dhaya Maya
Gokula Nandhana Sai Gopala
Raghukula Bhushana Sai Rama
He Madananthaka Dhaya Karo (2)
title: Guru Deva Priya Deva Sai Deva Dhaya Maya
translation: Sai is the merciful and enchanting Guru who is also Shiva, adorned with Vibhuthi. Sai si Gopala, Nanda's son, and Rama, the jewel of the Raghu dynasty.

lyrics:
Guru Devaya Namo Namo
Hey Parameshvara Namo Namo
Guru Devaya Namo Namo
Omkaraya Namo Namo
Partipurishvara Namo Namo
Jagadishvaraya Namo Namo
Prashanti Ishvara Namo Namo
title: Guru Devaya Namo Namo
translation: Bow to the supreme Lord and teacher, whose form is ""Om"". He is the Lord of Parthi and Lord of the Universe

lyrics:
Guru Mahima Gao (3)
Sadguru Sai Anantha Guru
Brahmananda Ananda Guru
Sarva Dharma Priya Sai Guru
Sai Guru Sathya Sai Guru
Sarva Dharma Priya Sai Guru
Guru Ki Vani Gao
title: Guru Mahima Gao
translation: Sing about the greatness of the eternal, universal, and ever-blissful teacher, Sathya Sai who loves all the religions; He is the truth, knowledge, and bliss

lyrics:
Guru Nanak Ji Ki Jai Jai Kar
Jo Bole So Hoye Nihal
Allah Sai Lelo Salam
Maula Sai Lelo Salam
Salam Salam Lakho Salam
Salam Salam Lelo Salam
Yeshu Pitha Prabhu Sai Ram
Buddha Zoarashtra Mahavir Nam
Salam Salam Lakho Salam
Sai Mera Salam
Salam Salam Lelo Salam
title: Guru Nanak Ji Ki Jai Jai Kar
translation: Salutations to the teacher, Nanak. Whoever recites the name of God reaches the final goal of liberation. Thousands of salutations to: Allah, Maula, Jesus, Buddha, Zoaraster, Mahavira, Ram and Sai Ram

lyrics:
Gurudeva Gurudeva Guruvayur Mura Hari Deva
Hari Narayana Bhaja Narayana
Sharanam Sharanam Guru Deva
Sharanam Sharanam Sai Deva
title: Gurudeva Gurudeva Guruvayur Mura Hari Deva
translation: Sing the name of the Lord and teacher, Lord of Guruvayur who killed the demon Mura. He is Sai Narayana (Vishnu). Let us surrender to Him.

lyrics:
Guruvayur Pura Shri Hari Krishna Narayana Gopal
Mukunda Madhava Muralidhari Narayana Gopal
Narayana Gopal Shri Hari Narayana Gopal(2)
Mohana Muralidhari Shri Hari Narayana Gopal
Govardhana Giridhari Murari Narayana Gopal
title: Guruvayur Pura Shri Hari Krishna Narayana Gopal
translation: Chant the names of the Lord of Guruvayur: Lord Hari, Krishna, Narayana, Gopal, Madhava, Muralidhara, Mukunda and Sai Narayana. Chant the name of Krishna the lifter of Govardhana Mountain

lyrics:
Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Sadhashiva
Om Namo Namo Namah Shivaya
Brahma Vishnu Surarchithaya Om Namo Namo Namah Shivaya
Uma Ganesha Sharavana Sevitha Om Namo Namo Namah Shivaya
Om Namo Namo Namah Shivaya
title: Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva
translation: Chant the auspicious name of Shiva, worshipped by all other aspects of God (Brahma, Vishnu). He is served by His divine consort, Uma, and their sons, Ganesha and Sharavana (Subramanya).

lyrics: Hara Hara Hara Hara Namami Shankara Bhaja Mana Sai Ram\nHara Hara Shiva Shiva Sadashiva Bhaja Mana Sai Ram (2)\nBhaja Mana Sai Ram
title: Hara Hara Hara Hara Namami Shankara
translation: O mind, worship Lord Sai Ram, and Lord Shiva (Lord Shankara). They destroy fears and miseries.

lyrics:
Hara Hara Hara Hara Samba Shiva
Vibhuti Sundara Sai Shiva
Gangadhara Hara Gauri Shiva
Trishuladhari Trinetra Shiva
Partipuri Paramesha Shiva
Vibuti Sundara Sai Shiva
title: Hara Hara Hara Hara Samba Shiva
translation: Chant the name of Shiva the three-eyed destroyer of evil. He bears the Ganges and the trident; chant the name of Sai Shiva of Parthi Who is adorned with holy ash.

lyrics:
Hara Shiva Shankara Bholenath
Parthi Purishvara Sai Nath
Shiva Shiva Shankara Bholenath
Shirdi Purishvara Sainath
Ahi Bhushana Shiva Gaurinath
Parama Sumangala Sainath
Girijananda Paramananda
Samadhi Priya Ganganath
title: Hara Shiva Shankara Bholenath
translation: Chant the name of Lord Shiva and Lord of Parthi. Lord of Gauri, adorned with a cobra, always blissful is the delight of Girija. He bears the river Ganges, bestows auspiciousness and He rejoices in the bliss of meditation.

lyrics:
Hara Shiva Shankara Shashanka Shekhara
Hara Bham Hara Bham Bham Bham Bolo
Bhavabhayankara Girijaa Shankara
Dhimi Dhimi Dhimi Thaka Nartana Khelo
title: Hara Shiva Shankara Shashanka Shekhara
translation: Chant the name of Lord Shiva, dancing to the rhythm of drums. Shankara, Lord of Girija, destroys the fear of the cycle of birth and death.

lyrics:
Hare Murare Sai Ram Hare Murare Ram
Parama Sumangala Sai Ram Parama Sumangala Ram
Allah Isvara Tere Nam Sab Tum Ho Bhagavan
Allah Ishvara Ek Hai Sab Tum Ho Bhagavan
Parama Sumangala Sai Ram Parama Sumangala Ram
title: Hare Murare Sai Ram
translation: Lord Hari is the destroyer of the demon Mura. Sai is the supreme Lord of goodness and auspiciousness. The forms of Allah, Shiva and Rama are embodied by Sai.

lyrics:
Hari Bolo Hare Ram Nam
Hari Bolo Hare Krishna Nam
Hari Bolo Satya Sai Nam
Hari Bolo Hare Ram Nam
title: Hari Bolo Hare Ram Nam
translation: Say the names of Vishnu, Rama, Krishna and Satya Sai.

lyrics:
Hari Hari Narayana
Hari Govinda Narayana
Hari Gopala Narayana
Hari Hari Narayana(2)
Hrishikesha Narayana
Parthisha Narayana
title: Hari Hari Narayana
translation: Chant the name of Lord Narayana, who removes the sins and sufferings of devotees. Lord Krishna, the cowherd and Lord Narayana of Hrishikesh are also the Lord of Parthi.

lyrics:
Hari Hari Om Shiva Shankara Om
Narayana Hari Om(2)
Keshava He Shiva Madhava He
Narayana Hari Om(2)
Paramatma Antaryami
Narayana Hari Om(3)
title: Hari Hari Om Shiva Shankara Om
translation: Hari(Vishnu), Shiva, Keshava, and Madhava personify Om, the primeval sound. The Lord is the supreme indwelling spirit.

lyrics:
Hari Nam Ghathe Chalo Sai Nam Ghathe Chalo
Madhava Govinda Govinda Madhava Nam Ghathe Chalo
Govinda Vitthala Gopala Vitthala
Jaya Parthi Vitthala Jaya Sai Vitthala (2)
Madhava Govinda Govinda Madhava Nam Ghathe Chalo
title: Hari Nam Ghathe Chalo
translation: Sing the name of Hari, Sai, Madhava and Govinda while traversing the path of life. Salutations to Lord Govinda, Vitthala, and Sai who resides in Parthi

lyrics:
Hari Om Ananda Narayana
Narayana Hari Narayana
Narayana Sai Narayana
Hari Om Ananda Narayana
Triloka Palana Narayana
Parthi Nivasa Narayana
title: Hari Om Ananda Narayana
translation: Chant the names of the Lord: Hari Narayana and Sai, the Lord of all the three worlds, residing in Puttaparthi.

lyrics:
Hari Om Namah Shivaya (2)
Hari Om Hari Om Hari Om Namah Shivaya (2)
Hari Om Om Om Hari Om Om Om Hari Om Om Namah Shivaya
Hari Om Hari Om Hari Om Namah Shivaya
title: Hari Om Namah Shivaya
translation: We bow to Lord Shiva, the embodiment of Lord Shiva.

lyrics: Hari Om Namah Shivaya\nShiva Shiva Shankara Hara Parameshvara Saishvaraya Nama Om(2)
title: Hari Om Namah Shivaya
translation: Bow to Lord Sai, the very embodiment of Lord Shiva.

lyrics:
Hari Om Tat Sat Namah Shivaya
Sai Om Tat Sat Namah Shivaya (2)
Hari Om Tat Sat Namah Shivaya
Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Shivaya
Sai Om Tat Sat Namah Shivaya
Hari Om Tat Sat Namah Shivaya
Sai Om Tat Sat Namah Shivaya
Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Shivaya
Sai Om Tat Sat Namah Shivaya (2)
title: Hari Om Tat Sat Namah Shivaya
translation: Bow to Lord Shiva, Sai and Hari, the embodiments of Om, and the Ultimate Truth

lyrics:
He Brahma He Vishnu
Dhaya Maya He Maheshwara
Sathya Sai Parameshwara
He Brahma He Vishnu
Mahashakthi Shiva Sai Shankara
Poorna Theja Sai Avathara
title: He Brahma He Vishnu
translation: Lord Sai, You are the embodiment of Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva. You are the ultimate Energy, and the effulgent one.

lyrics:
He Dina Dayalu Hare Sai Rama Hare Hare
Sai Ram Ghanashyam Sai Ram
He Dina Dayalu Hare Sai Rama Hare Hare
He Bandha Vimochana Rama Hare
He Papa Samharaka Sai Hare
Sai Ram Hare Hare
Sai Ram Ghanashyam Sai Ram
title: He Dina Dayalu Hare
translation: Lord Sai Rama is merciful to the afflicted. He liberates us from the worldly attachments and destroys our sins. Worship Lord Sai Rama and Ghanashyama.

lyrics:
He Gananatha Gajanana
Heramba Gajanana
He Gananatha Gajanana
Gauri Nandana Gajanana Gajanana He Gajanana
Siddhi Vinayaka Gajanana
Vara Siddhi Vinayaka Gajanana
title: He Gananatha Gajanana
translation: O elephant-faced Lord Ganesha, You are the Lord of the divine forces and remover of obstacles. Son of mother Gauri, You grant success to those who worship you.

lyrics:
He Gauri Natha Shiva Shankara
Hara Bham Bham Hara Bham Bham He Digambara
He Gauri Natha Shiva Shankara
Dam Dama Dam Dam Dama Dam Damarudhara
Bhola Bhandari Parameshwara
Hara Bham Bham Hara Bham Bham He Digambara
title: He Gauri Natha Shiva Shankara
translation: Worship the auspicious and all-pervading Lord Shiva, the beloved of Parvathi. He is full of grace, dancing to the rhythms of the drum. (Sound of Creation)

lyrics:
He Govinda He Ananda Nanda Gopala
Mohana Muralidhara Shyama Gopala
He Govinda He Ananda Nanda Gopala
Sundara Giridhari Hare Natavara Lala
Madhava Keshava Madhana Gopala
title: He Govinda He Ananda Nanda Gopala
translation: Chant the different names of Lord Krishna, son of Nanda, who plays enchanting music on the flute and dances beautifully.

lyrics:
He Indu Shekhara Raja Shiva Raja Shankara
He Indu Shekhara Shambho Shiva Raja Shankara
He Hara Hara Shiva Shiva Pinaka Vaibhava Raja Shankara
Shiva Raja Shankara
title: He Indu Shekhara Raja
translation: Chant the name of Lord Shiva adorned with the crescent moon and the Lord of all Lords, who holds the mighty and powerful bow.

lyrics:
He Kamala Nayana Bhagwan
He Sathya Sai Bhagwan
He Dina Jano Ke Pran
Pathitha Pavana Sai Ram
He Parthi Purishwara Shri Sai Ram
Shri Sai Ram Jaya Jaya Ram
Parthi Purishwara Shri Sai Ram
He Dina Jano Ke Pran
title: He Kamala Nayana Bhagwan
translation: The lotus-eyed Lord of Parthi, is the refuge and life-breath of the meek and fallen. Salutations to our Lord Shri Sai Ram.

lyrics:
He Kamala Vadhana Sai Ranga
Kaivalya Panduranga (2)
Sai Gopala Ghana Ghana Neela
Kutila Kunthala Tribhuvana Pala
Brahma Vishnu Maheshwara Roopa (2)
Maya Lola Brahma Swaroopa
title: He Kamala Vadhana Sai Ranga
translation: Lord Sai Ranga, with a face like the beautiful lotus flower, is the Supreme Spirit, Lord Panduranga, or the dark-complexioned Sai Krishna who protects the three worlds. He is the incarnation of Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva, and the cause of this illusory creation.

lyrics:
He Nandalala He Vraja Bala
Makhana Chora Yashoda Ke Bala
Brindavan Ke Gokula Bala
Daya Karo He Sai Nandalala
Makhaha Chora YashodaKe Bala
title: He Nandalala He Vraja Bala
translation: O Lord Krishna (son of Nanda), have mercy on us. The steale of butter (our hearts) and of Yashoda roams playfully in Brindavan.

lyrics:
He Parthi Pureesha Pazhani Girisha
Shambo Mahadeva Parvathi Thanaya
He Parthi Pureesha Pazhani Girisha
Om Sharavana Bhava Valli Manala
Mayura Vahana Ganapathi Sodhara
Bhaktha Samrakshaka Sathya Saisha
title: He Parthi Pureesha Pazhani Girisha
translation: O Lord Subrahmanya, who has his abode in Pazhani hills, we pray to thee. O son of Shiva and Parvathi, brother of Lord Ganesha, who has the Peacock as His vehicle, we bow to thee. Our Lord Muruga, who has Valli as His consort, is the protector of His devotees. He is our Lord Sathya Sai who resides in Parthi.

lyrics:
He Ram Bhagavan
He Karuna Sindhu Ram
He Dina Bandhu Sai Ram (2X)
Bhakha Premi Ko Karuna Karo
Daya Karo Raghu Ram
Mujhe Kr'pa Karo Sai Ram
He Janaki Jivan Ram
He Parthipurishvara Ram
He Dina Bandhu Sai Ram
title: He Ram Bhagavan
translation: O Lord Ram, You are the ocean of commapsion and friend of the helpless. Shower Your grace on the beloved devotees. O Lord Rama of the Raghu dynasty, life of Janaki, You dwell in Parthi

lyrics: He Shiva Shankara Namami Shankara Shiva Shankara Shambo\nHey Girijapathi Bhavani Shankara\nShiva Shankara Shambo (3)
title: He Shiva Gangadhara He Puttaparthishwara
translation: I bow to Lord Shiva, Girija's (Parvathi's) consort, and bestower of good fortune.

lyrics:
He Vishwanatha He Gaurinatha He Sai Natha Bhagwan
Daya Karo Daya Karo Daya Karo Bhagwan
He Vishwanatha He Gaurinatha He Sai Natha Bhagwan
Dina Dayala Sai Ghanashyama
Patita Pavana He Sai Rama
Daya Karo Daya Karo Daya Karo Bhagavan
title: He Vishwanatha He Gaurinatha
translation: O Lord of the Universe, Lord of Gauri, Lord Sai Ram, have mercy. Kindly protect the weak and shower Your grace on the fallen ones.

lyrics:
Heramba Janani Shri Sai Janani
Bhavani Jagadhambe Ma (2)
Thribhuvana Palini He Karunamayi
Uma Sharadamba (2)
Raksha Karo Sai Ma
title: Heramba Janani Shri Sai Janani
translation: Pray to and worship the Sustainer and Savior of Three Worlds, Mother of Ganesha, Bhavani, Uma and Sharada. O Mother Sai! We pray to Thee to protect us.

lyrics:
Hey Madhava Hey Madhusudhana
Damodhara Hey Muralidhara
Hey Madhava Hey Madhusudhana
Manamohana Hey Yadhunandana
Dinavana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
title: Hey Madhava Hey Madhusudhana
translation: Lord Krishna, destroyer of the demon Madhu, is Damodara. The Lord, son of Yadu Clan, captivates our minds with His divine flute, and removes the fear of birth and death.

lyrics:
Hey Ram Hey Guna Dham
Raghava Sundara Ram
Janaki Jivana Ram
Hey Ram Hey Guna Dham
Kaushalya Thanaya Raghukula Ram
Ayodhya Shiromani Dasharatha Ram
Jaya Jaya Ram Jaya Raghu Ram
Jaya Jaya Ram Jaya Sai Ram
title: Hey Ram Hey Guna Dham
translation: Beloved Rama, embodiment of all virtues, is the beautiful one from the Raghu dynasty. The life of Janaki (Sita) and the son of Queen Kaushalya is the crown jewel of Ayodhya, and the son of Dasharatha. Glory to Sai Ram

lyrics:
Hey Sai Jagannatha Hey Sai Jagannatha
Hey Sai Jagannatha
Dina Bandhu Sai Natha
Karuna Sindhu Jagannatha
Hey Sai Jagannatha Hey Shirdi Jagannatha
Hey Parthi Jagannatha
title: Hey Sai Jagannatha
translation: O Sai, Lord and protecter of this Universe You are the freind of the afflicted and the ocean of commpassion.

lyrics:
He Shiva Gangadhara He Puttaparthishwara
Narthana Sundara Gangadhara
Natana Manohara Bimbadhara
He Shiva Gangadhara He Puttaparthishwara
Dina Natha parthi Natha Sai Prabo
Krupa Karo Raksha Karo Sai Prabho
He Shiva Shankara Sai Pralayankara
Krupa Karo Raksha Karo Bhaktha Vatsala
title: Hey Shiva Shankara Namami Shankara
translation: O Lord Shiva, the One who holds the holy Ganges in His matted hair! whose dance is beautiful and enchanting, who has the moon in His head, who loves His devotees, You are the lord of the destitute. O Lord Shiva the Lord of Destruction, kindly protect the weak and shower Your grace on the fallen ones.

lyrics:
I keep feeling Your love in me, over and over again
And it's sweeter and sweeter as the days go by
Oh what a love between my Sai and I
My Sai and I
title: I Keep Feeling Your Love In Me
translation: None

lyrics:
Indweller of my heart, O Lord, Sai Baba
Redeemer of fallen, Salvation of trodden
Indweller of my heart, O Lord, Sai Baba
Hallowed be Thy Name. glorious be Thy Fame
Take me, O Lord, through the life into your realm
Sai Ram, Sai Ram, let's all rejoice, say Sai Ram
title: Indweller Of My Heart
translation: None

lyrics:
Ishwara Allah Tere Nam Ishwari Nandhana Sai Ram
Krishna Kristhu Tere Nam Karuna Sagara Sai Ram
Rama Raghava Tere Nam Shirdi Purishwara Sai Ram
Krishna Keshava Tere Nam Karuna Sagara Sai Ram
title: Ishwara Allah Tere Nam Ishwari Nandhana Sai Ram
translation: Lord Sai, son of Eshwaramma, You are known by many names: Ishwar, Allah, Krishna, Jesus, Rama, Shirdi Sai, and the ocean of mercy.

lyrics:
Ishwari Nandhana Sai Gopala
He Jaganmohana Krishna Krishna
Ishwari Nandhana Sai Gopala
Jagadoddhara Parthi Vihara
Prema Swroopa Premavathara
Dwarakamayi Shri Sathya Sai
Sai Jaganmohana Krishna Krishna
title: Ishwari Nandhana Sai Gopala
translation: O Sai, son of Eshwaramma, You are Krishna, the Lord of the Universe, incarnation and embodiment of love, who resides in Puttaparthi and Dwarakamayi (Shirdi Sai Baba's abode)

lyrics:
It's Your Maya Surrounding Me (2)
Gurudeva Saideva It's Your Maya Surrounding Me
I Surrender My Lord, at Your Feet
My Every Single Though, Word and Deed
Lift Your Maya Surrounding Me (2)
Open My Eyes So I May See
My True Identity
Sai, I Am One With Thee
title: It's Your Maya Surrounding Me
translation: None

lyrics:
Jagadambe Devi Bhavani
Jaganmate Shakthi Durge (2)
Jagadambe Devi Bhavani
Kumara Gananathamba Kalyani Shyamalamba
Janani Durge Varade Mata
Uma Maheshvari Kalavati
title: Jagadambe Devi Bhavani
translation: Glory to the Mother of the Universe, the Primal Energy, the destroyer of evil. O Mother of Ganesha and Subrahmanya (Kumara), O Mother with a dark complexion who promotes well-being, the bestower of boons, you are the consort of Lord Siva (Maheshvara). We pray to Thee.

lyrics:
Jagadhoddharini Maa
Vishwa Vilasini Maa
Sthira Sukha Dhayini Maa
Durgathi Nashini Maa
Parthipurishwari Parvathi Maa
Bhava Bhaya Harini Bhairavi Maa
Shambhavi Maa Gauri Maa
Jaya Parameshwari Jaya Bhuvaneshwari Jaya Parthishwari Parvathi Maa
title: Jagadhoddharini Maa
translation: Mother Goddess, who supports the Universe, provides unchanging and eternal comfort, destroys bad tendencies and fears of this worldly existence. Salutations to Mother Goddess of Parthi

lyrics:
Jagadishvari Daya Karo Ma
Shiva Shankari Krupa Karo Ma
Saishvari Raksha Karo Ma
Partishwari Daya Karo Ma
Shiva Shankari Krupa Karo Ma
title: Jagadishvari Daya Karo Ma
translation: O Divine Mother of the Universe, have mercy on us. O Mother Sai, protect us, and grant us boons and favors.

lyrics:
Jagadoddharini Mata Durga Jagadoddharini Ma
Jago Jago Ma Jago Jago Ma Jago Jago Ma Janani
He Durga Devi Ranachandi Devi
He Shiva Ramana Jago Ma (2)
Jago Jagadoddharini Ma
title: Jagadoddharini Mata Durga
translation: O universal mother Durga, please arise. O delight of Lord Shiva, Gauri Devi, Ranachandi Devi, kindly wake up (a plea for the inner awakening of our atmic reality).

lyrics:
Jagame Sarvam Vishnu Mayam
Sadguru Shri Satya Sai Mayam (2)
Jagame Sarvam Vishnu Mayam
Omkara Nada Mayam
Om Shiva Shakthi Mayam
Prema Mayam Sai Nama Mayam
Pranavakara Brahma Mayam
title: Jagame Sarvam Vishnu Mayam
translation: The entire creation and the universe is a suffusion of Lord Vishnu and the supreme teacher, Sathya Sai, of the sound of Om, of Lord Shiva and Mother Parvathi (Energy), of Love and the name of Sai

lyrics:
Jaganmathe Jagat Janani
Jaya Jagadambe Devi Bhavani
Jaganmathe Jagat Janani
Devi Saraswathi Durga Lakshmi
Mahishasura Samharini Matha
title: Jaganmathe Jagat Janani
translation: Victory to Goddess Amba, the Mother of the Universe The Universal Mother, is Saraswathi (bestower of knowledge), and Durga (Remover of evils). Greetings to the destroyer of Mahishasura (representing evil)

lyrics:
Jagath Palana Jagan Mohana
Sundara Sai Gopalana
Munijana Sevita Madhusudhana
Jagath Palana Jagan Mohana
Keshava Govinda Janardana
Shridhara Madhava Damodara
Achyuta Ananta Narayana
Sri Sai Krishna Narayana (2)
title: Jagath Palana Jagan Mohana
