translation: Mother Sai is the eternal truth. She grants perpetual bliss and freedom from fear, and protects the vituous.

lyrics:
Sathya Swaroopa Shri Sai Rama
Dharma Swaroopa Dhayabhi Rama
Sathya Swaroopa Shri Sai Rama
Shantha Swaroopa Sugunabhirama
Prema Swaroopa Prashanti Rama
Karuna Swaroopa Karunya Rama
Sathya Dharma Shanthi Prema Sundara Rama
Sarva Thathva Bodhaka Shri Sai Rama
title: Sathya Swaroopa Shri Sai Rama
translation: Lord Sai Rama is the personification of truth, righteousness, eternal peace, love and compassion. He is all merciful.

lyrics:
Satya Dharma Shanti Prema Swaroopa Prashanti Nilaya Deva
Rama Ho Krishna Ho Sai Rama Deva
Shiva Shakti Swaroopa Baba Hey Prema Pradayaka Baba
Hey Prashanti Nilaya Baba Hey Purnavathata Baba
Allah Ho Maula Ho Sai Rama Deva
title: Satya Dharma Shanti Prema Swaroopa
translation: The Lord of Prashanti Nilayam is the embodiment of truth, righteousness, peace, and love. He personifies Lord Krishna, Lord Rama, Shiva and Shakti. He is the complete incarnation of God. Head and protector of the weak.

lyrics:
Shambho Mahadeva Mallikarjuna
Mangala Charana Trilochana
Pinaka Pani Parvati Ramana
Shambho Mahadeva Mallikarjuna
Bhava Bhaya Harana Sanatana
Parthi Purishvara Patita Pavana
title: Shambho Mahadeva Mallikarjuna
translation: Chant the holy name of the Lord of Lords, Shiva, the Lord of Parvati. He is adorned with three eyes and the bow. The Lord of Parthi, destroys the fear of birth and death and protects the destitute.

lyrics:
Shambo Mahadeva Shiva Shambo Mahadeva
Samba Sadhashiva Sai Shankara Shambo Mahadeva
Hara Hara Hara Shambo Bhava Bhaya Hara Hara Shambo
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shambo Sathya Saishwara Shambo
title: Shambho Mahadeva Shiva Shambo Mahadeva
translation: Lord Shiva, Lord of Gauri, confers auspiciousness. He destroys the fear of mundane existence, and grants salvation

lyrics:
Shambo Mahadeva Shiva Shankara
Gangadhara Gaurivara
Hara Hara Gangadhara Gaurivara
Bimbadhara Chandra Maulishwara
Shambo Mahadeva Shiva Shankara
Hara Hara Mahadeva Saishwara (3)
Bimbadhara Chandra Maulishwara
title: Shambho Mahadeva Shiva Shankara
translation: Chant the name of the Lord of Lords, Shiva, consort of Mother Gauri. He is the bearer of the Holy Ganges and the crescent moon. Lord Sai is the embodiment of Lord Shiva.

lyrics:
Shambo Shankara Deva
Bhole Baba Mahadeva
Bhole Baba Sai Deva
Shambo Shankara Deva
Pahi Prabho Sharanam Deva (2)
Bhole Baba Mahadeva
Bhole Baba Sai Deva
Hara Hara Gange Mahadeva (3)
Bhole Baba Mahadeva
Bhole Baba Sai Deva
title: Shambho Shankara Deva
translation: O easy-to-please Lord Shambo Shankara (Shiva)! O Sai, Lord of Lords! I surrender to Thee. Protect me and destroy my sins.

lyrics:
Shambho Shankara Shiva Shambho Shankara
Shambho Shankara Samba Sadashiva Shambho Shankara
Parthi Nayaka Paramesha Pahi Mam (3)
Shambho Shankara Samba Sadashiva Shambho Shankara
Parvati Nayaka Paramesha Pahi Mam (3)
Shambho Shankara Samba Sadashiva Shambho Shankara
title: Shambho Shankara Shiva Shambho Shankara
translation: Please protect me O Lord Shiva, the Lord of Parvati. Please protect me O Lord of Parthi.

lyrics:
Shambo Shiva Shankara
Gangadhara Hara Gauri Shiva
Shambo Shiva Shankara
Hara Hara Mahadeva Kailasa Vasa
Parthisha Paramesha Pahi Prabho
title: Shambho Shiva Shankara
translation: Worship Lord Shiva, the Lord of Gauri, the resident of Kailasa, who holds the holy Ganges. O Lord Sai of Parthi, please protect us.

lyrics:
Shambu Kumara Harohara
Shiva Shankari Bala Harohara
Uma Sutha Shanmukha Guha
Shiva Sharavana Bhava Harohara
Pazhani Girisha Harohara
Puttaparthi Purisha Harohara
Hara Hara Hara Hara Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva
Shiva Sharavana Bhava Harohara
title: Shambu Kumara Harohara
translation: Glory be unto the son of Shiva and Shakthi, Lord Subrahmanya, the Lord of Pazhani and Parthi.

lyrics:
Shankara Nama Bhajo
Shankara Shankara Nama Bhajo
Shankara Nama Bhajo
Pithambara Dhara Sai Shankara
Chandra Kaladhara Sai Manohara
Shankara Nama Bhajo
title: Shankara Nama Bhajo
translation: Chant the name of Lord Shankara, the beloved of Gauri, who wears the moon on His head. Chant the name of Lord Sai who wears the saffron robe.

lyrics:
Shankara Sadashiva Chandrashekara
Chandrashekara Sai Shankara
Nila Kantha Shula Dhari Sai Shankara
Bhala Nethra Tripurahari Sai Shankara
Chandrashekara Sai Shankara
title: Shankara Sadashiva Chandrashekara
translation: Worship Lord Shiva who wears the crescent moon on His head and holds the trident. Shiva, with the third eye of wisdom transcends space and time. Lord Sai is the embodiment of Shiva.

lyrics:
Shankara Shankara Shankara Shankara Shambo Shankara
Shiva Shambo Hara Shambo Shiva Shiva Shiva Shambo
Shiva Shambo Hara Shambo
Shambo Shankara Saisha
Shankara Shankara Shankara Shankara Shambo Shankara
Trishuladhari Trinetradhari
title: Shankara Shankara Shankara Shankara Shambo Shankara
translation: Worship Lord Shankara, Shiva, who has three eyes and The Trident.

lyrics:
Shata Bar Kahore Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram
He Mangala Nayana Ram He Gopi Jivana Shyam
He Shirdi Ke Bhagwan He Prashanti Nilaya Ram
Shata Koti Namana Sai Ram
Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram
title: Shata Bar Kahore Sai Ram
translation: Repeat the name of Sai, millions of times. He is also Rama with graceful eyes, and Shyam, the life breath of the Gopis. Glory of Shirdi and Prashanti Nilayam.

lyrics:
Shesha Sai Narayana Vasudeva Narayana
Pasa Nasha Narayana
Narayana Sai Narayana
Narayana Sathya Narayana
Sai Rama Sathya Sai Krishna
Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram
Sai Ram Ram Sai Ram Ram Sai Ram Ram Sai Ram
Sai Ram Ram Ram Ram Sai Ram Ram Ram Ram...
...Sai Ram Ram Ram Ram Sai Ram
title: Shesha Sai Narayana Vasudeva Narayana
translation: Oh Lord Sai, you are Lord Narayana, and Vasudeva. You as Narayana prevent Pasa (the noose of death) from affecting your devotees. Salutations to you Lord Sai, who is also my Rama and Krishna.

lyrics:
Shirdi Mahadeva Deva Shirdi Mahadeva
Shanthi Prema Sadguru Natha
Shirdi Puri Vasa Deva
Shirdi Ke Sai Natha Sadguru Natha
Shirdi Ke Sai Natha Sadguru Deva
Guru Dev Guru Dev Guru Dev Guru Dev (2)
title: Shirdi Mahadeva Deva Shirdi Mahadeva
translation: Worship the Lord of Lords, of Shirdi, the Supreme Divine Guru. Lord Sai personifies peace and love.

lyrics:
Shirdi Sai Dvarakamayi Prashanthi Vasi Sai Ram
Sai Ram Sai Ram Eka Nam Sundara Nam
Shirdi Sai Dvarakamayi Prashanthi Vasi Sai Ram
Allah Ishvara Sai Ram
Partipuri Ke He Bhagavan
Daya Karo Daya Karo Daya Karo He Bhagavan
Daya Karo Krupa Karo Raksha Karo He Bhagavan
Sai Ram Sai Ram Eka Nam Sundara Nam
title: Shirdi Sai Dvarakamayi Prashanthi Vasi Sai Ram
translation: Have mercy O Lord, who resides in Dvarakamayi (abode of Shirdi Baba) and in Puttaparthi. Just uttering the name ""Sai Ram"" is beautiful. The Lord of Parthi is also Allah and Ishvara.

lyrics:
Shirdi Sai Parthi Sai Hamko Dijo
Premamrutadhara Premamrutadhara
Tava Seva Ke Avasar Dijo Satya Sai Mahadev
Ganamruta Me Bhava Bhi Dijo Prema Sai Bhagavan Prema Sai Bhagavan
title: Shirdi Sai Parti Sai Hamko Dijo
translation: O Lord Shirdi Sai, Parthi Sai, and Prema Sai, grant us the nectar of love. Let us serve You. Bless us so we may sing Your glory with love and devotion.

lyrics:
Shiva Kumarane Shakti Balane Va Va Va
Sharavanabhava Guha Shanmuga Vela Va Va Va
Omkara Tattuvame Ni Va Va Va
Partipurisha Sai Nada Va Va Va
Kanda Va Va Va
Vela Va Va Va
Sai Va Va Va
title: Shiva Kumarane Shakti Balane
translation: Grace us with Your presence, O Lord Shanmuka! Son of Siva and Shakthi, You are the inner meaning of Omkara. Please come, O Lord Sai residing in Parthi.

lyrics:
Shiva Maheshvara Shiva Maheshvara Shiva Maheshvara Sai Ram
Shiva Maheshvara Shiva Shankara Shiva Mahadeva Sai Ram
Kailasa Vasa Mahadeva
Jagadishvara Hara Mahadeva
Tribhuvana Pala Baba Sai Deva (Om)
title: Shiva Maheshvara Shiva Maheshvara Shiva Maheshvara Sai Ram
translation: Chant the name of Lord Sai Rama, Lord Shiva and Lord of Lords. He resides in Kailasa (the Heavens) and protects the entire Universe.

lyrics:
Shiva Shambo Shambo Shiva Shambo Mahadeva
Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva Shiva Shambo Mahadeva
Halahaladhara Shambo Anatha Natha Shambo
Hari Om Hari Om Hari Om Namah Shivaya
Hari Om Om Om Hari Om Om Om Hari Om Namah Shivaya
title: Shiva Shambo Shambo
translation: Let us bow to the Lord of Lords, Shiva, the destroyer of evil. He is the Lord of the destitute, who swallowed the poison to save His devotees.

lyrics: Shivaya Namah Om, Shivaya Namah Om, Namah Shivaya (x 6)
title: Shivaya Namah Om
translation: I bow to You, Lord Shiva, embodiment of the primeval sound Om.

lyrics: Shivaya Namah Shiva Shivaya Namah Shiva Shivaya Namah Om Namah Shivaya\nShivaya Namah Shiva Shivaya Namah Shiva\nShivaya Namah Om Namah Shivaya
title: Shivaya Namah Shiva
translation: All glory and obeisance to Lord Shiva, the embodiment of Om.

lyrics:
Shivaya Parameshvaraya Chandra Shekharaya Namah Om
Bhavaya Guna Sambhavaya Shiva Tandavaya Namah Om
Shivaya Parameshvaraya Chandra Shekharaya Namah Om
Bhavaya Guna Sambhavaya Shiva Tandavaya Namah Om
title: Shivaya Parameshvaraya
translation: Lord Shiva, who wears the moon on His forehead, is the embodiment of all good qualities. The cosmic dancer represents the entire creation.

lyrics:
Shri Guru Jai Guru Sadguru Sai
Satchidananda Sada Sukh Dayi
Shri Guru Jai Guru Sadguru Sai
Amrita Varshini Anandadayini
Atmanivasini Shri Satya Sai
title: Shri Guru Jai Guru Sadguru Sai
translation: Sautations to our true guru, Sai, the personification of truth, knowledge, and bliss. The indweller mother Sai bestows us and showers us with immortality and eternal bliss

lyrics:
Shri Guru Jaya Guru Sai Guru Deva
Brahma Vishnu Shiva Guru Deva
Shri Guru Jaya Guru Sai Guru Deva
Srishti Guru Sthithi Guru Laya Guru Deva
Siddha Guru Loka Guru Satya Sai Deva
title: Shri Guru Jaya Guru Sai Guru Deva
translation: Glory be to Lord Sai, the universal teacher. He grants liberation and is the cause of creation, preservation and dissolution.

lyrics:
Shri Purandara Sai Vittala
Shri Hari Madhava Govinda Vittala
Shri Purandara Sai Vittala
Pandari Natha Panduranga Vittala
Bhaktha Samrakshaka Shri Krishna Vittala
Parthi Purandara Sai Ranga Vittala
title: Shri Purandara Sai Vittala
translation: Chant the name of Vitthala ofPandhari (Lord Krishna). He is Lord Sai the savior of His devotees and resides in Puttaparthi.

lyrics:
Shri Raghu Nandana Dasharatha Nandana
Bhadradhishvara Rama
Vaidehi Priya Vaikuntha Rama
Sada Smarami Rameti Rama
title: Shri Raghu Nandana Dasharatha Nandana
translation: Worship Lord Rama of the Raghu dynasty, the son of King Dasharatha. Pray to and always remember the auspicious Lord Rama, the beloved of Sita and the resident of Vaikuntha (Heaven). He is worshipped in the temple at Badhrachalam.

lyrics:
Shri Raghu Nandana Janaki Jivana
Rama Rama Rama Sai
Rama Rama Rama Ram
Alakha Niranjana Asura Nikhandana
Rajiva Lochana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
Rama Rama Rama Sai
Rama Rama Rama Ram
title: Shri Raghu Nandana Janaki Jivana
translation: Chant the name of Lord Rama, Prince of the Raghu dynasty and Lord of Sita. O Lotus eyed Lord Rama, You are the destroyer of demons and also of the cycle of birth and death.

lyrics:
Shri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Jaya Ram Janaki Jeevana Ram
Pathitha Pavana Rama Hare Jaya Raghava Sundara Ram
Dinoddharana Rama Hare Jaya Maruthi Sevitha Ram
Jaya Jaya Ram Jaya Raghu Ram Janaki Jeevana Ram
title: Shri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Jaya Ram Janaki Jeevana Ram
translation: Lord Rama is the life-breath of Mother Janaki (Sita). The charming Prince of the Raghu dynasty, and the savior of the fallen is worshipped by Hanuman.

lyrics:
Shri Rama Jaya Rama Jaya Jaya Rama
Shri Rama Jaya Rama Sundara Rama
Shri Rama Jaya Rama Jaya Jaya Rama
Shri Rama Jaya Rama Mangala Dhama
Shri Rama Jaya Rama Atma Rama
Shri Rama Jaya Rama Sita Rama
Shri Rama Jaya Rama Sai Rama
title: Shri Rama Jaya Rama Jaya Jaya Rama
translation: Chant the name of Lord Rama, who is beautiful, auspicious and is the indwelling spirit.

lyrics:
Shri Ramachandra Jaya Ramachandra
Raghuvira Ranadhira Raghukula Rama
Raghuvira Ranadhira Shri Sai Rama
Shri Ramachandra Jaya Ramachandra
Dasharatha Nandana Dayabhi Rama
Dhanava Bhanjana Kodhanda Rama
Kalyana Rama Kamaniya Rama
Raghuvira Ranadhira Raghukula Rama
title: Shri Ramachandra Jaya Ramachandra
translation: Glory to valiant Lord Rama of the Raghu dynasty. He is the compassionate son of Dasharatha, charming and lovely He destroyed the demons (evil tendencies) with His bow.

lyrics:
Shri Ranga Shri Ranga Ranga Ranga Shri Ranga (2)
Kaveri Thata Vasa Kasturi Ranga
Karunya Lavanya Karunantaranga
Hey Panduranga Hey Sai Ranga (2)
title: Shri Ranga Shri Ranga
translation: Lord Sai Ranga! The one who resides on the banks of river Kaveri. You are infinitely merciful and compassionate.

lyrics:
Shrikari Krupa Kari Kshemamkari Saishwari
Shankari Abhayankari Shubankari Saishwari
Tandava Kheli Priya Kari Bhairavi Pralayankari
Sarveshwari Sundari Dayakari Maheshwari.
title: Shrikari Krupa Kari
translation: Mother Sai is Shankari, who is the provider of prosperity, well-being and protection. She delights in her cosmic dance. The beautiful Lord is all merciful and is the cause of final dissolution.

lyrics:
Shyama Gopal Jai Jai Sai Ram
Prem Bharo Dil Me Hamare Sai Ram
Hamare Sai Ram Bade Pyare Sai Ram
Prem Bharo Dil Me Hamare Sai Ram
Ham Bhakto(n) Ke Thum Ek Sai Ram
Thumara Jagat Me Bada Pyara Pyara Nam
Sanga Raho Har Dam Hamare Sai Ram
Sanga Raho Hamare Sai Ram
title: Shyama Gopal Jai Jai Sai Ram
translation: Glory to you Sai Gopala. O Sai Ram, please fill our hearts with love. Beloved Sai Ram, You are the one God for us devotees. Yours is the most beloved name in the whole Universe. Please be with us, every moment of our life.

lyrics:
Soham Soham Dhyana Karo
Sadguru Sai Dhyana Karo
Soham Soham Dhyana Karo
Soham Brahma Soham Vishnu
Soham Sai Dhyana Karo
Soham Atma Shiva Paramatma
Brahmananda Se Hrudaya Bharo
title: Soham Soham Dhyana Karo
translation: Meditate on ""Soham"" (meaning: He and I are One) and recite the names of Lord Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva and Sai. Fill the heart with infinite bliss by realizing the highest Self.

lyrics:
Subrahmanya Subrahmanya
Subrahmanya Sai Subrahmanya (2)
Arumugam Shiva Shanmugam
Sri Bala Subrahmanya
Kandha Muruga Kadamba Kadhirvela
Sura Samhara Sevarkodiya
Ishvara Netra Kumara Gurupara
Valli Deva Senapate Subrahmanya
title: Subrahmanya Subrahmanya
translation: Chant the names of Lord Muruga (Subrahmanya) who has six faces. The son of Shiva is also known as Kandha, Kadamba and the one with the resplendent mace as His weapon. He has the rooster on His flag and He is the destroyer of the demon Sura. The one born from Shiva's third eye, the one who has Valli and Deva Sena as His consorts is our Sai Subrahmanya.

lyrics:
Sunada Vinodhini Sai Janani
Bhavani Jagan Mohini Sai Janani
Sunada Vinodhini Sai Janani
Shambavi Shiva Shankari Sai Janani
Shankari Narayani Sai Janani
Bhagavathi Varadayini Sai Janani
title: Sunada Vinodhini Sai Janani
translation: Chant the names of Mother Sai, the embodiment of ""Om"". She is the Mother Parvathi (Bhavani, Shambavi, Shankari and Bhagavathi), the bestower of wishes and the Mother of all creation.

lyrics:
Sundara Mukha Shri Gajanana
Ekadanta Shri Gajanana
Prathama Namami Gajanana
Rishi Muni Vanditha Gajanana
Gajanana Om Gajanana (3)
title: Sundara Mukha Shri Gajanana
translation: Worship charming faced Lord Gajanana, who has one tusk and who is worshipped by saints and sages.

lyrics:
Sundara Shyama Murari Sai
Gopala Shri Hari Shri Hari (2)
Parama Niranjana Madhava Sai
Sakala Charachara Vyapaka Sai
Gopala Shri Hari Shri Hari (2)
title: Sundara Shyama Murari Sai
translation: Chant the many names of all-prevading and ever blissful Lord Sai, who is Gopala, Hari and Madhava

lyrics:
Thirupathi Malai Mel Iruppavane
Thirada Vinai Ellam Theerppavane
Srinivasa Govinda Shri Venkatesha Govinda
Ullamam Kovilil Iruppavane Ulagorai Vazhvikka Vandhavane
Sankatam Thavirtthidum Govinda Venkata Ramana Govinda
Ezhu Malai Mel Iruppavane Ella Vinaigalaiyum Theerppavane
Shirdi Sai Govinda Shri Sathya Sai Govinda
title: Thirupathi Malai Mel Iruppavane
translation: Lord Govinda, residing on Mount Thirupathi, is the remover of all sins. He is the dweller in the temple of the heart, who incarnated to save the world. Residing beyond seven hills, He is also Lord Shirdi Sai and Sathya Sai.

lyrics:
Tripura Sundari Ma Amba Daya Sagari Ma
Sundara Vadani Ma Amba Suguna Manohari Ma
Jaya Jagat Janani Ma Amba Jagadoddharini Ma
Parthi Nivasini Ma Amba Papa Vimochani Ma
title: Tripura Sundari Ma
translation: Mother Amba, with the beautiful countenance, is an ocean of mercy and full of virtuous attributes. Glory to the Mother of the Universe, the destroyer of sins and to the resident and Lord of Parthi.

lyrics:
Tripurari Shiva Shankara
Naga Bhushana Nagabharana
Tripurari Shiva Shankara
Omkareshwara Namah Shivaya
Mahakaleshwara Namah Shivaya
title: Tripurari Shiva Shankara
translation: Bow to Lord Shiva, adorned with the snake, who transcends time and space. He is the personification of ""Om"" and and is the Lord of Parthi and Shirdi.

lyrics:
Tum Ho Anatha Natha Bhagavan
O Sai Mere Prana Sakha Bhagavan
Matha Pita Guru Bandhu Tumhi Ho
Bhaktha Sakha Bhagavan
Dina Sakha Bhagavan
Bhagavan Bhagavan
O Sai mere Prana Sakha Bhagavan
title: Tum Ho Anatha Natha Bhagavan
translation: O Lord Sai ! Thou art the Lord of destitutes. Thou art the Mother, Father, Teacher, Kith and Kin and my life-force.

lyrics:
Va Va Murugaiya Vadivel Azhaga
Ka Va Va Kumara Thiru Karthikeya
Vava Murugaiya Vadivel Azhaga
Singara Vela Shiva Shakthi Bala
Sangitha Lola Sathya Saisha
Va Va Muruga Vadivel Azhaga (6)
title: Va Va Murugaiya Vadivel Azhaga
translation: Come O beautiful Lord Muruga! Protect us, Karthikeya, the youthful son of Shiva and Shakthi, and the bearer of the divine spear. You are Lord Sathya Sai, who enjoys divine music.

lyrics:
Vahe Guru Vahe Guru Vahe Guru Bol
Sat Nam Sat Nam Sat Nam Bolo
Vahe Guru Bolo Sat Nam Bolo
Govinda Bol Gopala Bol (2)
Govinda Bol Bol Gopala Bol (2)
Radha Ramana Hari Govinda Bol
title: Vahe Guru Vahe Guru Vahe Guru Bol
translation: Victory to the Guru. Recite the names of the Lord Krishna Hari constantly.

lyrics:
Vanamali Radha Ramana Giridhari Govinda
Nila Megha Sundara Narayana Govinda
Vanamali Radha Ramana Giridhari Govinda
Bhaktha Hrudhaya Mandhara Bhanukoti Sundara
Nandha Nandha Gopa Vrindha Narayana Govinda
Hari Narayana Govinda (8)
Narayana Narayana Narayana Narayana (7)
Nila Megha Sundara Narayana Govinda
title: Vanamali Radha Ramana Giridhari Govindha
translation: The dark-hued Lord Krishna, the beloved of Radha, resides in the devotee's heart. He is the son of Nandha and His beauty equals the effulgence of a million suns.

lyrics: Vighneshwaram Bhajore Manasa Vighna Haram Bhajare (3X)
title: Vighneshwaram Bhajore Manasa
translation: O mind, Worship Lord Ganesh, who removes obstacles from our path.

lyrics:
Vinayaka Vinayaka
Vishwadhara Vinayaka
Siddhi Vinayaka Bhava Bhaya Nasha
Sura Muni Vandhitha Shri Ganesha
Vishwadhara Vinayaka
title: Vinayaka Vinayaka
translation: Worship the omnipresent Lord Ganesha who is the remover of obstacles and is the support of the Universe. He blesses us with success and removes the bondage of birth and death. He is worshipped by saints and sages.

lyrics:
Vittala Vittala Hari Vittala
Vittala Vittala Nam Bhajo Hari Vittala
Panduranga Vittala Vittala Vittala Nam
Vittala Vittala Nam Bhajo Hari Vittala
Vittala Vittala Sai Vittala
title: Vittala Vittala Hari Vittala
translation: Sing the names of Lord Vishnu: Hari, Panduranga, and Vittala.

lyrics:
We are Blessed, We are Blessed, We are Blessed
Sai Baba is watching over us
We are Here to Sing Your Sweet Name
Let the Light of Your Glory shine on us
Bless us All with Your Presence Gurudev
We are Blessed, We are Blessed, We are Blessed
No more tears, No more sorrow, No more death
Banish the darkness with Your Love
We are born in the Golden Age of Sai
We are Blessed, We are Blessed, We are Blessed
title: We Are Blessed We Are Blessed We Are Blessed
translation: None

lyrics:
We sanctify the day the Lord is born within us
Glorifying God, we celebrate this day
We sanctify the day the Lord is born within us
No other day Lord, this is our new birth
No other way Lord, this is our true birth
Living a life of loving service
Glorifying God, we celebrate this day
title: We Sanctify The Day The Lord Is Born Within Us
translation: None

lyrics:
Yadu Nandana Gopala
Jaya Brindhavana Pala
Jaya Murali Gana Vilola
Gopala Gopala Sai Gopala
title: Yadu Nandana Gopala
translation: Victory to Lord Gopala, the beloved of the Yadhava lineage. Glory to the Lord who enchants our hearts with divine music on His flute.

lyrics:
Yadu Nandana Yashoda Bala
Madhava Keshava
Yadu Nandhana Yashoda Bala
Mathura Natha Mama Sai Natha
Mandara Giridhari Madhusudhana He
title: Yadu Nandhana Yashoda Bala
translation: O delight of the Yadu lineage, son of Yashoda, You are the Lord of Mathura. You supported the Mandara mountain, and destroyed the demon Madhu. Lord Sai, I bow to you.

lyrics:
Yogishwara Sathya Saishwara
Parthipurisha Pavana
Pathithoddhara Sai Ram
Amritha Rupa Ananda Dhatha
Ishwari Nandana Sai Ram
Jagadoddara Sai Ram
Shri Sathya Sai Swagatham
title: Yogishwara Sathya Saishwara
translation: Welcome, Lord Sai, master of the saints, holy Lord of Parthi, uplifter of the weak. Son of Mother Eshwaramma, personification of the Eternal, grants bliss and protects the Universe.

lyrics:
Yuga Yuga Ke Avatara Tumhi Ho
Mere Ram Mere Shyam Shirdi Sai Parthi Ram
Jaga Ke Palana Hara Tumhi Ho
Allah Ishvara Tere Nam
Tere Nam, Tere Nam
Allah Ishvara Tere Nam Shirdi Sai Parthi Ram
Jaga Ke Palana Hara Tumhi Ho
title: Yuga Yuga Ke Avatara Tumhi Ho
translation: Lord of Shirdi and Parthi are the same as Rama and Krishna. The Lord has incarnated in every age and is the Sustainer of entire creation. He is Allah and Ishvar. Lord Sai Ram, please grant intelligence and equal-mindedness to all.
